title: ICT Engineer - Site Engineering
description:
Join our Team
   

  

**About this opportunity:**
 BNEW SAN Lab Operations provides world class lab infrastructure, networks and HW Services to the R&D organizations. Through our standardized solutions and services, we enable our stakeholders to configure and deploy design and test environments. We provide engineering IT environments supporting more than 23 000 R&D engineers and operate ~50 000 square meters of labs at our sites in Stockholm, Linköping, Lindholmen and Lund in Sweden and globally through the sites in Aachen, Athlone, Budapest, Beijing, Nanjing, Genoa, Jorvas, Ottawa, Pagani and Piscataway.
   

  

**What you will do:**
 We are looking for an ICT Engineer that want to be part of SAN SAL LSO STO Building & Site Engineering team.
   

  

 Main tasks will be installation documentation and guidelines as preparation for coming builds and project .
   

  

 As well as lab capacity planning in our Stockholm labs. The journey to automate has begun and much of the work is done in Hydra. Lab Operations provide hardware solutions for the internal Ericsson users. ICT Engineers ensure a stable environment and optimize the solutions/services to the agreed service levels in a cost efficient and timely manner.
   

  

 This role will be based in Stockholm, reporting to the Manager STO Building Operations and Site Engineering (BOPS & SE).
   

  

**You will…**
* Be responsible for the planning of future growth and adaption of the local needs.
* Be responsible for change management, capacity management and process management.
* Supervising the FM supplier’s operation and maintenance activities, to ensure work is executed in an optimal, safe and suitable manner.
* Supervising the FM suppliers to achieve best possible performance, utilizing company Ericsson policies and procedures as appropriate.
* Be responsible for incident management and subsequent investigation to establish root cause analysis by the FM supplier.
* Overseeing the operation and maintenance of data center and labs, critical service systems (main infra structure).
* Responsible for, and in collaboration with the FM supplier, identify ways which the full range of maintenance services can be improved in ways which maximize value, minimize cost, risk, and downtime, whilst delivering the desired consistent quality of service.


**The skills you bring:**
* Ericsson Business Process.
* Change and Improvement Management.
* Project Management Process.
* Business Understanding.
* Technology Solutions.
* IT Processes, IT Tools and Infrastructure.
* Technical Support.
* Ericsson Knowledge.
* Continuous Improvement Process.
* Ericsson Portfolio.


**Additional Requirements**
* Understanding of different Software operating systems
* Automation
* Hydra


**Why join Ericsson?**
 At Ericsson, you´ll have an outstanding opportunity. The chance to use your skills and imagination to push the boundaries of what´s possible. To build solutions never seen before to some of the world’s toughest problems. You´ll be challenged, but you won’t be alone. You´ll be joining a team of diverse innovators, all driven to go beyond the status quo to craft what comes next.
   

  

**What happens once you apply?**
 Click Here to find all you need to know about what our typical hiring process looks like.
   

  

 Encouraging a diverse an inclusive organization is core to our values at Ericsson, that's why we champion it in everything we do. We truly believe that by collaborating with people with different experiences we drive innovation, which is essential for our future growth. We encourage people from all backgrounds to apply and realize their full potential as part of our Ericsson team. Ericsson is proud to be an Equal Opportunity and Affirmative Action employer, learn more.
   

  

**Primary country and city:** 
 Sweden (SE) || Stockholm
   

  

**Job details:** 
 ICT Engineer
   

  

 ]]>

title: IT Security Specialist to Identity Access Management
description:
**Job ID: 21386** 






  
 





 We are looking for an IT Security Specialist with an analytical mindset to join our Identity and Access Management (IAM) organisation. This is an opportunity for you to be a part of an international team, eager to support our mission to Protect the Bank: De-risked, Compliant, Secure & Protected.
 





  
 





**About this opportunity** 






  

  



 At IAM we provide centralised and standardised IAM services, and act as a single point of contact for all units within Nordea acquiring these services. IAM belongs to the Cyber Security area within Nordea. 
 







  
 







 The Onboarding and Integrations team consists of dedicated IT Security Specialists, Product Owner and Scrum Master. We analyse, support and onboard Nordea applications to the IAM controls, thus enabling Applications Owners to fulfil Compliance requirements put on them by the Bank and regulations.
 







  
 







**What you will be doing:** 





* Support Application Owners with the Onboarding of their applications to the IAM controls, predominantly to the IIQ system
* Analyse and coordinate complicated questions related to Application Onboarding
* Together with the team, own our procedures and instructions and collaborate with Process Owners to keep these relevant
* Be the IT Security specialist when it comes to IAM controls and onboarding
* Have close collaboration with the PO and SM in order to help them set realistic goals and support Projects and Audit request
* Work with constant improvements in our ways of working and processes





  
 







**Who you are** 






  

  



 Collaboration. Ownership. Passion. Courage. These are the values that guide us in being at our best – and that we imagine you share with us.  
 







  
 







**To succeed in this role, we believe that you have:** 





* A strong driving force and good technical skills
* Stakeholder mindset
* Analytical mind and interest in investigating requests
* Ambition to always find long term solutions
* Ability to explain technical issues to both non-technical and technical people
* A structured and organised way of working with the ability to deliver results with high quality
* A proactive, constructive and 'can-do' oriented mind-set





  
 







**Your experience and background:** 





* Experience working with IAM solutions and processes
* Good knowledge about IAM
* Understanding of IT processes and software development lifecycle
* Experience working cross-borders with different cultures
* Previous experience working with Agile methodology and SAFe is a must
* Fluency in both written and spoken English is a must





  
 







**Location** 
 Workplace for this role can be either Helsinki, Stockholm, Oslo or in the TriCity Area in Poland. We offer high flexibility in remote work, although expected two days per week at the office.
 





  

  



 If this sounds like you, get in touch!
 





  
 





**Next steps**




 Submit your application no later than
 



 08/09/2024
 



 .
 





  
 





 For more information, you’re welcome to contact Head of IAM Onboarding, Sona Celik at sona.celik@nordea.com.
   

  

 At Nordea, we know that an inclusive workplace is a sustainable workplace. We deeply believe that our diverse backgrounds, experiences, characteristics and traits make us better at serving customers and communities. So please come as you are.
 





  

  



 Please be aware that any applications or CVs coming through email or direct messages will not be accepted or considered.
 





  
 





**Only for candidates in Sweden -** 
  For union information, please contact finansforbundet@nordea.se or SACONordea@nordea.com.
 





  
 





**Only for candidates in Poland -** 
 Please include permit for processing personal data in CV as following: 
 





  
 





 In accordance with art. 6 (1) a and b. Regulation (EU) 2016/679 of the European Parliament and of the Council of 27 April 2016 on the protection of natural persons with regard to the processing of personal data and on the free movement of such data, and repealing Directive 95/46/EC (General Data Protection Regulation) hereinafter ‘GDPR’. I agree to have: my personal data, education and employment history proceeded for the purposes of current and future recruitment processes in Nordea Bank Abp. 
 





  
 





 The administrator of your personal data is: Nordea Bank Abp operating in Poland through its Branch, address: Aleja Edwarda Rydza Śmiglego 20, 93-281 Łodź. Your personal data will be processed for the recruitment processes in Nordea Bank Abp. You have a right to access your personal data, right to rectify and right to delete. Disclosing the personal data in the scope specified by the provisions of Polish Labour Code from 26 June 1974 and executive acts are mandatory. Providing personal data is necessary to conduct the recruitment processes. The request for the deletion of your personal data means resignation from further participation in recruitment processes and causes the immediate removal of your application. Detailed information concerning processing of your personal data can be found at: https://www.nordea.com/en/doc/nordea-privacy-policy-for-applicants.pdf.
 





  
 





 We reserve the right to reply only to selected applications.

title: IT Application Specialist till Linde Gas
description:
Linde Gas söker en stark problemlösare med passion för teknik som vill fortsätta utvecklas i rollen som Applikationsspecialist. Här en del av ett starkt team med hög kompetens och engagemang. Vi ser fram emot din ansökan!
 



  

**Företag :**
 Linde Gas
 



  

**Plats :**
 Solna, Stockholm
 



  

**Jobbkategori :**
 IT
 



  

**Omfattning :**
 Heltid
 



  

**Startdatum :**
 Enligt överenskommelse
 



  

**Typ av uppdrag :**
 Rekrytering
 



  

**Övrigt :**
 Möjlighet till distansarbete
   




**Om tjänsten**

 Som Applikationsspecialist på Linde Gas kommer du att ansvara för två plattformar, Accura och Linx. Accura är en egenutvecklad applikation som används av Lindes kunder, såsom sjukhus, för att hantera lager och beställningar. Linx är en handdatorapplikation för Lindes återförsäljare i syfte att hålla koll på lagerhållning. Du kommer att arbeta nära applikationsägare och externa partners för att underhålla och förbättra dessa system, samt säkerställa att de fungerar optimalt.
 


  


  

**Du erbjuds**



  

  
* Möjligheten att arbeta på ett globalt företag med stora utvecklingsmöjligheter
  
* Stöd och utbildning för att utveckla din tekniska kompetens
  
* En dynamisk arbetsmiljö med engagerade och kunniga kollegor
  

  


**Arbetsuppgifter**
  
* Utföra underhåll, uppdatering och utveckling på plattformarna
  
* Ge kvalificerad systemteknisk support i samarbete med applikationsägare
  
* Arbeta direkt med applikationsägare för att förstå och hjälpa till att definiera nya applikationskrav
  
* Säkerställa lämplig kunskapsöverföring för applikationer som utvecklats med externa partners för att möjliggöra internt stöd
  

  


**Vi söker dig som**
  
* Har en relevant utbildningsbakgrund, troligtvis inom IT
  
* Har erfarenhet av applikationsutveckling, och gärna SAP-relaterad
  
* Grundläggande kunskaper i Java och Azure
  
* Flytande svenska och engelska i tal och skrift
  
* Har en bred teknisk bakgrund
  
* Har erfarenhet av att hantera leverantörer
  


  


  

**För att lyckas i rollen har du följande personliga egenskaper:**



  

  
* Målmedveten
  
* Ordningsam
  
* Stabil
  
* Ansvarstagande
  


  

  

**Vår rekryteringsprocess**
  


 Denna rekryteringsprocess hanteras av Academic Work och vår kunds önskemål är att alla frågor rörande tjänsten skickas till Academic Work.
 


  


 Vi tillämpar löpande urval och kommer plocka ner annonsen när tillräckligt många kandidater har nått slutskedet i rekryteringsprocessen. Rekryteringsprocessen innehåller två urvalstest: ett personlighetstest och ett test i kognitiv förmåga. Testerna är ett verktyg för att kunna hitta den kandidat med högst potential för tjänsten samt främja jämlikhet, mångfald och en rättvis rekryteringsprocess.
   




**Linde Gas**

 Linde är ett ledande globalt företag inom industrigaser och teknik. Linde lever efter sin mission att göra vår värld mer produktiv varje dag genom att tillhandahålla högkvalitativa lösningar, teknologier och tjänster som gör deras kunder mer framgångsrika och hjälper till att upprätthålla, avkarbonisera och skydda vår planet.
 


  


 Lindes industrigaser och teknologier används i otaliga applikationer, inklusive produktion av ren väte som är kritisk för energiomställningen, livräddande medicinsk syrgas och högrenade specialgaser för elektronik, bland annat. I över 50 år har Linde varit en global ledare inom väte och utnyttjar sin ingenjörskompetens, tillsammans med en betydande tillgångsbas och expertis, för att göra renare energi till verklighet världen över.
   




**Bli direktrekryterad till Linde Gas**

 Detta är en direktrekrytering, vilket betyder att den kandidat som får tjänsten blir direktanställd av kundföretaget. Rekryteringsprocessen hanteras av Academic Work.
   




**Har du frågor om tjänsten?**

 Mikaela Hofstedt eller någon av kollegorna i rekryteringsteamet svarar dig gärna på stv3@academicwork.se Ange annons-ID i ditt mail: 15105985

title: Regeringskansliet söker en servertekniker med fokus på IT-säkerhet
description:
**It infrastruktur, it-enheten, Förvaltningsavdelningen**
**Din arbetsdag. Sveriges morgondag.**
 Du kommer att arbeta självständigt och tillsammans med andra med att installera, underhålla, övervaka och säkra de system som gruppen har i uppdrag att förvalta. Du och dina kollegor utgör ett team av it-tekniker som arbetar med separata it-lösningar som omfattas av säkerhetsskydd.
   

  

 Arbetsuppgifterna kräver att du har ett gott omdöme, en hög integritet och är säkerhetsmedveten. Du kommer ges möjligheten att vidareutbilda dig och bygga erfarenhet inom förvaltning av säkra it-system.
   

  

 Läs mer om Regeringskansliets IT-enhet på Regeringen.se
   

  

**Varför är servertekniker-rollen rätt för dig?**
**Säkerhetsfokus:** 
 Du är säkerhetsmedveten och har integritet i åtanke. Att hantera säkerhetskänslig information är en central del av ditt arbete.
   

  

**Kompetens och erfarenhet:** 
 Du har en gedigen bakgrund inom IT, inklusive kunskaper i skriptning, virtualisering, serveradministration, Microsoft Active Directory och Group Policies. Att analysera loggfiler och övervaka system är inget nytt för dig.
   

  

**Strävan efter utveckling:** 
 Du är hungrig på att utvecklas och tar gärna initiativ. Att lösa problem och vara noggrann är din grej.
   

  

**Mångsidighet:** 
 Det är meriterande om du kan MFA, nätverk, härdning av applikationer och OS samt har arbetat med detta i säkerhetsskyddsklassade system. Har du en högskoleutbildning är ett plus.
   

  

**Din bakgrund**
 Vi söker dig som har gymnasieutbildning eller för anställningen utbildning inom relevant område. Skriptning är ett naturligt verktyg för dig som du använder för att förenkla och automatisera ditt arbete. Du har en bakgrund inom en it-supportorganisation, goda kunskaper och erfarenhet av att ha arbetat inom virtualisering och serveradministration där enklare nätverksfelsökning har varit en del i arbetet.
   

  

**Dina egenskaper**
 För att lyckas i rollen som servertekniker inom serversäkerhetsområdet krävs att du har vilja och förmåga att utvecklas, är noggrann, tar initiativ och är ansvarstagande. Dessutom är du prestigelös och ödmjuk samt gillar att lösa problem.
   

  

**Övrigt**
 Anställningen är en tillsvidareanställning och inleds med sex månaders provanställning. Anställningen är placerad i säkerhetsklass och en säkerhetsprövning med registerkontroll kommer att genomföras innan beslut om anställning fattas. Du måste vara svensk medborgare, men får gärna ha utländsk bakgrund. I den här tjänsten erbjuder vi inte distansarbete .
   

  

**Är du intresserad?**
 Vill du veta mer om jobbet och vad vi erbjuder, kontakta gruppchef Edward Miller på 08-405 83 87. Du är också välkommen att kontakta HR-handläggare Carl Garellick på 08-405 44 49. Fackliga representanter nås via Regeringskansliets växel 08-405 10 00; Saco (Johan Strokirk), Seko (Lars Vestberg) samt ST (Karina Åbom Engberg).
   

  

 Välkommen att registrera din ansökan i vårt rekryteringsverktyg senast den 13 september 2024.
   

  

 Vi tar gärna emot samtal från dig som är intresserad av jobbet men vi tackar nej till dig som säljer annonser och rekryteringstjänster.
   

  

 Regeringskansliets uppdrag är att stödja regeringen i dess arbete med att styra Sverige och förverkliga sin politik. Här arbetar 4 800 personer, varav 600 utomlands. Regeringskansliet välkomnar sökande med olika bakgrund och erfarenheter. Vi ser jämställdhet och mångfald som en styrka och tillgång och vi arbetar aktivt för att vara en arbetsplats fri från diskriminering. Förvaltningsavdelningen ansvarar för myndighetsövergripande frågor som förändrings- och förnyelsearbete, ekonomi, arbetsgivarfrågor, kompetensförsörjning, kommunikation, säkerhet, it, bibliotek, arkiv och registratur samt för den gemensamma servicen i Regeringskansliet.

title: Business Intelligence Analyst
description:
Scania Trucks - Business Intelligence and Analytics
   

  

 Do you want to solve complex problems and test bold hypotheses? To you want to be a pioneer, taking Scania Trucks into the age of data? Do you want to further accelerate the solutions journey, completely centering around our customers – both in terms of sustainability and profitability? Then you think like us.
   

  

 Do you also like reaching objectives as a team, having peers to bounce ideas with and a team spirit where we support each other? Then you will enjoy working with us!
   

  

 Who we are
   

  

 Scania Trucks is picking up speed in the solution provider journey, customer collaboration journey and data journey, and our team ‘Business Intelligence and Analytics’ is at the fore front. We develop new ways of working and we provide insights to teams around us. We do this by connecting the so far unconnected data and we are slowly moving into the predictive arena. As Scania Trucks is responsible for the whole trucks business, sales volume and profitability of both vehicles and services, the impact of our work is both important and immediate.
   

  

**About The Role**
 We are now looking for the successor of one of our consultants who has been the technical backbone in our team. As part of Scania Trucks so we work in the center of the business, in very close cooperation with all business owners. The work mostly aims at getting tools and reports in place building on Power BI and Power Apps, and includes everything from getting the data connections in place to the design of dash boards. It also includes coaching our more business oriented Business Intelligence Analysts in technical questions. The overall objectives are to increase process automation and our ability to make good data driven decisions.
   

  

 Role summary
   

  

  

* Expert developer of Data Models, Power BI reports, Power Apps tools and other process automation tools
* Technical expert co-creating Power BI reports, Power Apps tools and other process automation tools
* Partner in other analyses, where your knowledge in the available data, data models, APIs and you creative mind will lead to better conclusions and decisions
* Active driver of a harmonized and accessible infrastructure, that facilitates connections of data between data sources


 Who you are
   

  

 To be successful, you combine the relevant technical development competencies with personal skills in both coaching business owners to be good stake holders and in co-developing with other Business Intelligence Managers. You are patient, methodological, pedagogical and humble towards the importance of different stakeholders’ areas of competency. Being a team player is central. You probably have experience from the IT landscape of Scania or another big company.
   

  

 You strive to build wide contact networks with long term relationships through good team work, communication, structure and trust. A great passion for the success of Scania’s customers and for our ability to meet the Science Based Targets is a plus!
   

  

 You have skills in Power BI, advanced DAX, Power Query M, SQL and data models and it’s an advantage if you also know Power Apps, Python, Snowflake/Dremio or similar and Power BI Service.
   

  

 You have a Master’s Degree in Data Science or similar education and practical experience. You are more than five years into your career and are looking for your next big challenge.
   

  

 If you think that you are suitable for this position, we encourage you to apply as soon as possible. At Scania Trucks Business Intelligence and Analytics we celebrate difference and care deeply about diversity and inclusion – if you do not match all the requirements, please demonstrate how your passion, attitude and interest in the success of Scania’s customers and our ability to meet the science based targets might compensate for this!
   

  

 For any questions, please contact Karl-Johan Priem at karl-johan.priem@scania.com, please apply latest by 18 September.

title: Nätverkstekniker
description:
Exalt Network erbjuder produkter och tjänster för alla typer av nätverk för ett digitalt hållbart samhälle; mobiltelefoninät, fibernät, fastighetsnät, wifi och radionät inklusive 5G där Exalt designar, installerar och tillhandahåller drift och underhåll av nätverken för våra kunder. Våra kunder i den privata sektorn är telekomföretag, fastighetsbolag och fastighetsförvaltning, logistikföretag och butikskedjor samt privata vård- och omsorgsföretag därI den offentliga sektorn arbetar vi med sjukhushus och vårdcentraler, offentliga verksamheter som skolor och andra offentliga fastigheter samt de kommunala Stadsnäten i Sverige. Med hög kompetens och lång erfarenhet inom kommunikationsinfrastruktur ser vi till att kunder får ROBUSTA NÄTVERK och SÄKER KOMMUNIKATION. Bolaget är sedan 2005 noterat på Spotlight Stock Market (kortnamn EXALT). För mer information, vänligen besök www.exalt.se
   

  

**Beskrivning**
 Som Nätverkstekniker kommer du att spela en nyckelroll i att designa, implementera och underhålla avancerade nätverkslösningar för våra kunder. Du kommer att vara involverad i projektstyrda arbeten, från designfas till drift och underhåll av aktiva kommunikationsnät, inklusive switching, routing, brandväggar och trådlösa nätverk.
   

  

 Precis som vi, så är du en innovativ och ärlig lagspelare som vill ha kul tillsammans på jobbet. Du ansvarar för dina egna kunder, driftavtal och leveranser samtidigt som du samarbetar med övriga kollegor och partners. Med din hjälp säkerställer vi att våra kunder får den bästa lösningarna inom säker infrastruktur. Avdelningen har 24/7 jour året runt.
   

  

 Har ett stort eget driv och engagemang för att driva våra kunders utveckling samt är genuint intresserad av IT- och nätverk och har god teknisk förståelse
   

  

**Arbetsuppgifter**
 Vi jobbar i team på projektuppdrag mot kund. Det kan inkludera design, projektering, installation, felsökning, drift och underhåll och nyinstallation av kommunikationsnät.
   

  

 Dokumentation av arbete/projekt.
   

  

 Effektivisering och förbättringsförslag.
   

  

 Ansvar för kunders leveransförväntningar.
   

  

**Kvalifikationer**
 Gärna certifieringar inom Aruba, Fortinet, Juniper och Cisco eller har motsvarande kompetens.
   

  

 Gedigen kunskap inom LAN/WAN, switching/routing, felsökning, nätanalys, brandväggar, Wifi.
   

  

 Ett plus om du har erfarenhet av att implementera och genomföra konfigurationer av nät och aktiva komponenter.
   

  

 Gedigna kunskaper i det svenska och engelska språket.
   

  

 Gärna Körkort B eller på gång inom kort.
   

  

 Affärsmässigt uppträdande gentemot kund.
   

  

 Ansökan:
   

  

 Om du är nätverkstekniker och gillar att arbeta både strategiskt och operativt med teknik så tveka inte att höra av dig, skicka in din ansökan idag!
   

  

 Rekryteringen är pågående och tjänsten kan tillsättas innan sista ansökningsdagen.För frågor kring tjänsten går det utmärkt att maila mig på niclas.orrelov@exalt.se
   

  

 Med vänliga hälsningar
   

  

 Niclas Orrelöv
   

  

 Dina framtida kollegor Hos oss på Exalt hittar du skidåkare, ölbryggare, jägare, gamers, musiker, filmnördar, båtmänniskor, scouter, golfare, padelproffs och mycket mer! Det vi har gemensamt är ett otroligt engagemang för det vi gör och att alltid vilja ge bästa service till våra kunder. Vi välkomnar olikheter och vi gillar att umgås och lära oss av varandra. Vår företagskultur har formats och fortsätter att formas av de människor som arbetar på Exalt. Några saker vi gör tillsammans: AW på kontoret & teamevents Kick off, sommarfest & julbord Gemensamma frukosttillfällen Rundpingis på vårt pingisbord som är hjärtat i vårt öppna arbetslandskap
   

  

 Anställningsform: tillsvidareanställning | Anställningens omfattning: heltid | Antal lediga befattningar: 1 | Sysselsättningsgrad: 100 | Ort: Solna | Län: Stockholms län | Land: Sweden | Referensnummer: 2024/7 | Kontakt: Niclas Orrelöv , | Publicerat: 2024-09-04 | Sista ansökningsdag: 2024-10-04

title: Operational IT Service Owner with an interest in Network and Security to Stockholm School of Economics
description:
Are you passionate about working broadly with IT services and ensuring the smooth delivery of critical technology solutions? Do you thrive in a dynamic environment and aspire to advance your career in IT service management? If you're looking for a rewarding opportunity to develop and grow professionally, then join us at the Stockholm School of Economics (SSE) as an IT Service Owner!
   

  

 We are currently seeking an IT Service Owner to join our IT Department at the Stockholm School of Economics (SSE) who will manage, develop, implement and work hands on with our IT Services. We believe you have a solid foundation in IT service management, with a few years of relevant experience. As part of a small team with diverse roles, you will be expected to work both strategically and hands-on with IT service management tasks.
   

  

**Responsibilities**
 As an IT Service Owner at SSE, you'll have a pivotal role in managing and optimizing our IT services. Your responsibilities will include a wide range of tasks, such as:
   

  

* Overseeing the entire lifecycle of IT services, ensuring they effectively meet the needs of the organization and its users.
* Coordinating with various stakeholders to define service requirements and align them with business objectives.
* Proactively identifying areas for service improvement and implementing solutions to enhance service delivery.
* Ensuring well-functioning IT operations and maintenance.
* Monitoring service performance and responding to incidents and service requests efficiently.
* Staying updated with the latest trends and best practices in IT service management to continuously optimize service quality.
* Establishing and ensuring compliance with budgetary requirements.


**Your profile**
 In this role, it is essential to be problem-solving, driven, and proactive, with a strong ability to take initiative and work independently with what is needed. Excellent communication skills are a must, along with the ability to work effectively with diverse teams and individuals. A service-minded approach and a people-friendly attitude are highly valued. Additionally, being structured and flexible will help you thrive in our international and entrepreneurial environment. A dedication to ongoing learning and improvement, essential for staying at the forefront of our ever-evolving field.
   

  

**Requirements**
* A few years’ experience from similar tasks, such as IT service management and IT security tasks.
* Experience from procurements. This includes tasks such as identifying needs, sourcing suppliers, negotiating contracts, and managing vendor relationships to ensure cost-effective and high-quality procurement outcomes.
* A higher education, from a relevant field such as IT or Technology.
* Fluency in English and Swedish, both written and spoken.


**Preferred qualifications:**
* Certification in IT Security.
* Experience in network security, mobile security, client security, IT security systems, and access systems.
* Understanding of cybersecurity principles and best practices.
* Previous experience in a similar work environment.
* Proficiency in IT service desk operations.


**Additional information**
 This is a full-time permanent position with a six-month probationary period.

title: Vi söker Konsulter / Interim inom IT-säkerhet
description:
**Är du konsult / interim och söker nytt uppdrag inom IT-säkerhet / Cybersäkerhet? Vi söker nu flera till våra kunder i Sverige!**
 Vi söker nu efter kompetenta och erfarna IT-säkerhetskonsulter för spännande uppdrag runt om i landet. Är du en expert inom IT-säkerhet och vill arbeta med utmanande projekt? Då vill vi komma i kontakt med dig!
   

  

 Vi söker dig som driver eget bolag idag, alternativt om du är öppen för att bli anställd direkt av oss. Du behöver inte vara tillgänglig omgående utan vi ser också ett stort värde i en kontakt nu för framtida uppdrag.
   

  

**Vi erbjuder dig**
* Möjlighet att komma i kontakt med en mängd spännande kunder, från små och medelstora företag till stora organisationer och myndigheter.
* Kunna få uppdrag baserat på dina intressen och expertområden.
* Ha flexibilitet att arbeta på plats hos kunder eller på distans.
* Stärka din kompetens genom att delta i varierande och utmanande projekt.


**Det här gör du hos oss**
 Vi Letar Efter Konsulter Med Bred Erfarenhet Inom IT-säkerhet, Som Kan Bidra Med Sin Expertis Till Företag Och Organisationer i Varierande Branscher. Exempel På Arbetsområden
   

  

* Genomföra säkerhetsgranskningar och penetrationstester.
* Designa och implementera säkerhetsarkitektur och -lösningar.
* Hantera och utreda säkerhetsincidenter.
* Rådgivning kring riskhantering och regelefterlevnad (t.ex. GDPR, ISO 27001).
* Utbilda personal i säkerhetsmedvetenhet.


**Ditt team och arbetsplats**
 Vi har kunder runt om hela Sverige, vilket innebär att vi kommer kolla efter uppdrag utifrån ditt önskemål.
   

  

**Mer om dig**
 Vi Söker Dig Som Är Konsult / Interim Och Som Har God Erfarenhet Och Stort Intresse Av Att Arbeta Inom IT-säkerhet Eller Motsvarande. Du Kan Komma Både Från Utveckling Och Infra, Samt Vara Van Att Jobba Både Operativt Och Strategiskt. Exempelvis Har Du
   

  

* Erfarenhet av att arbeta med IT-säkerhet, gärna i olika typer av projekt.
* Goda kunskaper inom säkerhetsverktyg, protokoll och standarder.
* Förmåga att snabbt sätta dig in i kunders behov och utforma skräddarsydda lösningar.
* Certifieringar inom IT-säkerhet (t.ex. CISSP, CISM eller liknande) är meriterande men inte ett krav.
* Förmåga att arbeta självständigt och kommunicera effektivt med både tekniska och icke-tekniska intressenter.


 Vi söker konsulter som är tillgängliga i närtid, men vi ser också att vi kommer ha behov framåt så hör gärna av dig eller gör en ansökan om du också kommer va tillgänglig längre fram. Vi har dig gärna i vårt nätverk för framtida uppdrag!
   

  

**Så här får vi kontakt**
 Detta är ett konsultuppdrag där du antingen blir anställd av oss på Ada Digital eller anlitas som underkonsult, beroende på vilken lösning som passar dig bäst. I tillsättningen strävar vi efter att ge dig en transparent, inkluderande och snabbrörlig rekryteringsupplevelse. Och vi vill veta mer om dig och din potential! För att ansöka behöver du inte bifoga några dokument. Skriv istället en kort motivering och bifoga din LinkedIn-profil. Urval kommer sker löpande och uppdraget kan bli tillsatt före sista ansökningsdatum. Är du nyfiken och vill veta mer innan du söker? Hör av dig till ansvarig rekryterare. Vi ser fram emot att få kontakt med dig!

title: Industrial Engineering Trainee
description:
Do you have a passion for optimizing processes and driving operational excellence?
   

  

 Are you ready to make a tangible impact from day one?
   

  

**If so, we have the opportunity for you!**
 The role as Industrial Engineering Trainee is a fixed-term role for 6 months. You will work within Airmee’s Operations team, focusing on the Kallhäll terminal, and report directly to the CEO and Head of Operations. It is an exciting and challenging opportunity for someone who wants to be part of a fast-paced company that is disrupting the traditional logistics industry.
   

  

 Airmee is one of Sweden's fastest-growing logistics companies. Backed by some of the country’s leading investors and entrepreneurs, we are revolutionizing last-mile deliveries and the way they are experienced. Through our research-based technology that leverages machine learning, we help e-retailers offer their customers the fastest and most convenient deliveries on the market.
   

  

**The role:**
 Overall, the role involves mapping out the workflows at our terminals & loading hubs, which includes process optimization, workflow analysis, and the integration of technology-driven solutions in logistics as well as obtaining a shared understanding of the flow. This includes:
   

  

* Documenting and formalizing how we currently operate.
* Connecting existing SOPs and process descriptions with new ones.
* Ensuring that processes are effective and followed throughout the organization.


 We work in a highly data-driven environment, with all our processes—such as sorting, loading, and delivery—being technology-driven. These processes must be optimized as much as possible to ensure precise delivery, and you will contribute to this effort. To secure the most efficient delivery possible, we are increasing transparency throughout the entire chain, from package handling at our terminals to the final delivery to the consumer.
   

  

 Location: Kallhäll, Stockholm
   

  

**Your qualifications:**
* Degree in Industrial Engineering / Industrial Technologies /Logistics Engineering / Supply chain or a similar field
* Advanced proficiency in Excel/Sheets, Power BI, preferably experience with, Notion
* Experience in management systems / industrial processes, industrial planning procedures or similar
* Fluent in Swedish and English


**Who you are:**
 It is a fixed-term role for 6 months, but you’ll have great opportunities to advance within the company.
   

  

 Selection is ongoing, so apply today if you’re curious about how we can revolutionize the logistics industry together for a sustainable future! 💚♻

title: Data Steward
description:
**Job ID: 24725** 








 Are you a graduate with an IT background or an IT/Data analyst looking to build competence in data management? 
   

  

 We are now looking for a motivated Data Steward to support implementation of data governance initiatives, maintain business critical data with a view to improve data quality and reduce risk, and build strong stakeholder relationships.
 

  
 





 At Nordea, we see that the world is changing fast – and we want to be one step ahead of the curve. That’s why we’re deeply committed to providing the financial solutions of tomorrow to our customers.
 





  
 





 We’re creating an agile environment where we experiment and grow together – and we need your ideas and unique background. With us, you’ll be in good company with a chance to make your mark on something bigger. 
 





  

  



**About this opportunity** 


  
 





 Welcome to AWM COO in the Application Portfolio and Data Management team. You’ll join AWM COO, a professional, fun and collaborative unit striving to “make it happen” – delivering excellence through tangible results. This will be a unique opportunity for you to grow your career not only in Nordea but also in data governance.
 

  
 





 What you’ll be doing:
 

  
 


* You will be responsible for metadata maintenance and documentation, implementing data quality controls and supporting risk mitigation activities
* You will be responsible for performing BAU activities such as extracting data sets, configuring rules in relevant systems, and supporting with data classification and naming
* You will implement and be responsible for deliveries in various projects and initiatives in the bank
* You will work cross-functionally with stakeholders and contribute to developing communication materials, training, instructions on data usage





 The role is based in Stockholm or Helsinki.
 





  

  



**Who you are**




 Collaboration. Ownership. Passion. Courage. These are the values that guide us in being at our best – and that we imagine you share with us.  We are looking for a pro-active, energetic and results-driven individual to take this role to the next level and who sees this as an opportunity to grow in the data governance field!
   

  

 To succeed in this role, we believe that:
 

  
 


* You have a strong drive and the strategic ability to see what needs to be done, both in the short and long term, with a solution-oriented mindset
* You enjoy investigating and gathering information about data, and have attention to detail
* You have strong collaboration skills and work well in a team environment
* You have excellent stakeholder management skills, can navigate and collaborate across the value chain in AWM and Nordea
* You have good English skills, both written and orally.



  

  



  Your experience and background:
 

  
 


* You have a minimum of 1 year relevant experience working with data in business, project or data management related role (or equivalent coursework experience)
* Experience working with data quality, standards or controls
* Work experience using SQL (or equivalent coursework experience)
* Knowledge of savings products and business model is an advantage



  
 





 If this sounds like you, get in touch!
 





  
 





**Next steps**




 Submit your application no later than
 



 18/09/2024
 



 . For more information, you’re welcome to contact Clara San Inocencio on tel: +46737471848 or e-mail: clara.san.inocencio@nordea.com.
   

  

 At Nordea, we know that an inclusive workplace is a sustainable workplace. We deeply believe that our diverse backgrounds, experiences, characteristics and traits make us better at serving customers and communities. So please come as you are.
 





  
 





 Please be aware that any applications or CVs coming through email or direct messages will not be accepted or considered. 
 





  
 





 If you are an external consultant interested in this role and wish to apply please contact the hiring people leader for separate instruction on how to apply.

title: DevOps-ingenjör sökes till KTH
description:
Verksamhetsstödets uppgift är att stödja universitetets utbildning och forskning. KTH:s verksamhetsstöd är inne i en spännande fas där vi tillsammans arbetar med utveckling av våra arbetsformer. Som medarbetare inom verksamhetsstödet bidrar du till KTH:s uppdrag att forska, utbilda och skapa samhällsnytta och får samtidigt möjlighet till egen professionell utveckling.
   

  

 Dra nytta av en unik möjlighet att vara med och forma framtiden vid KTH, Sveriges ledande tekniska universitet, känt för sitt engagemang i att skapa kunskap och kompetens för en hållbar framtid. Vi vill nu utöka vårt framåtsträvande team på IT-avdelningen och söker en DevOps-ingenjör.
   

  

 Vi söker dig som är en erfaren DevOps-ingenjör som är passionerad för molntekniker, särskilt Azure, och som har gedigen erfarenhet av att arbeta med infrastruktur som kod. Du kommer att spela en central roll i att självständigt skapa och hantera avancerade CI/CD-pipelines och automatisera lösningar som stärker vår IT-infrastruktur och stödjer universitetets kärnverksamheter.
   

  

**Vi erbjuder**
* En anställning på ett ledande tekniskt universitet som skapar kunskap och kompetens för en hållbar framtid
* Engagerade och ambitiösa kollegor samt en kreativ, internationell och dynamisk miljö


 Läs mer om hur det är att arbeta på KTH.
   

  

**Kvalifikationer**
**Krav**
* Flera års erfarenhet som systemutvecklare eller systemadministratör, med en stark inriktning på molnplattformar, särskilt Azure
* Erfarenhet av att arbeta med infrastruktur som kod och självständigt skapat och hanterat avancerade CI/CD-pipelines med hjälp av Azure Pipelines och Azure Bicep
* Djup förståelse för Azure-plattformen och dess olika tjänster, inklusive virtuella maskiner, molnlagring, virtuella nätverk, Azure Functions, Azure App Service, Azure Container Apps (ACA), Azure Monitor, Log Analytics, Application Insights, Azure KeyVault samt API Management
* Stark kompetens inom automatisering och scripting med verktyg som PowerShell, Bash, Python eller liknande
* Förmåga att kommunicera obehindrat på engelska är ett måste, och goda kunskaper i svenska är meriterande, för effektivt samarbete inom teamet och med kollegor inom och utanför IT-avdelningen. Det officiella språket för kommunikation och dokumentation är svenska.


**Personliga Egenskaper**
 För att trivas i tjänsten som DevOps- ingenjör på KTH krävs att du som person har förmåga att samarbeta med andra utvecklare i teamet och i andra utvecklingsteam. Du drivs av att utforska nya lösningar och göra väl avvägda kompromisser för att skapa framdrift och samtidigt behålla fokus på kvalitet och säkerhet.
   

  

**Meriterande**
* Högskoleexamen eller yrkesutbildning inom IT, IT-säkerhet, DevOps eller liknande
* Tidigare arbetat med liknande miljöer och haft roller som DevOps-ingenjör eller liknande


 Vi kommer lägga stor vikt vid personliga egenskaper.
   

  

**Fackliga representanter**
 Kontaktuppgifter till fackliga representanter.
   

  

**Ansökan**
 Du ansöker via KTH:s rekryteringssystem. Du som sökande har huvudansvaret för att din ansökan är komplett när den skickas in. Ansökan ska vara KTH tillhanda senast sista ansökningsdagen vid midnatt, CET/CEST (CentralEuropean Time/Central European Summer Time).
   

  

 Om anställningen
   

  

 Anställningen gäller tillsvidare enligt avtal.
   

  

 Anställningen inleds med sex månaders provanställning.
   

  

**Övrigt**
 Strävan efter jämställdhet, mångfald och lika villkor är både en kvalitetsfråga och en självklar del av KTH:s värdegrund
   

  

 För information om behandling av personuppgifter i samband med rekrytering.
   

  

 Om anställningen är placerad i säkerhetsklass, krävs en godkänd säkerhetsprövning i enlighet med säkerhetsskyddslagen (2018:585) för att bli behörig. Information om tjänsten är placerad i säkerhetsklass ges i samband med rekryteringsprocessen.
   

  

 Vi undanber oss direktkontakt med bemannings- och rekryteringsföretag samt försäljare av platsannonser.
   

  

 Om KTH KTH är ett av Europas ledande tekniska universitet och en viktig arena för kunskapsutveckling. Som Sveriges största universitet för teknisk forskning och utbildning samlar vi studenter, forskare och fakultet från hela världen. Vår forskning och utbildning omfattar såväl naturvetenskap som alla grenar inom teknik samt arkitektur, industriell ekonomi, samhällsplanering, historia och filosofi. Läs mer här
   

  

 Anställningsform: tillsvidare med provanställning | Anställningens omfattning: heltid | Antal lediga befattningar: 1 | Sysselsättningsgrad: 100% | Ort: Stockholm | Län: Stockholms län | Land: Sweden | Referensnummer: VP-2024-0243 | Kontakt: Maryam Ahmadzadeh Jahromi mail:maryamah@kth.se, | Publicerat: 2024-09-04 | Sista ansökningsdag: 2024-09-30

title: KPMG söker junior assistent till Stockholm!
description:
*Har du precis tagit studenten från gymnasiet och är redo att starta din karriär på en arbetsplats där du kan göra skillnad? Är du nyfiken på att utvecklas i en högpresterande miljö innan du fortsätter dina studier på universitet eller högskola? KPMG i Stockholm söker nu dig som är driven och vill samla värdefull arbetslivserfarenhet. Tjänsten är en 12 månaders visstidsanställning med start i början av oktober 2024. Ta chansen att få en stark start på din karriär i en dynamisk och utmanande roll!*
**Vad kan du förvänta dig hos oss?**
 På KPMG i Stockholm blir du en del av ett team som arbetar med kunder inom olika branscher. Vi kombinerar lokal förankring med fördelarna av att vara en del av ett globalt nätverk med specialistkompetens.
   

  

**Din roll som Junior Associate:**
 Som Junior Assistent på KPMG kommer du att vara en viktig del av vårat Business Support-team och få möjlighet att lära dig av erfarna medarbetare. Du kommer att bidra med olika arbetsuppgifter inom redovisning, både hantera och samordna leverantörsfakturor men också vara en del av en stödfunktion för revisorerna. Vi vill att du genom ditt nytänkande sätt bidrar till att automatisera och förenkla vårt fakturahanteringsflöde. Du kommer att utveckla dina kunskaper och färdigheter inom inte bara redovisning och revision, utan även din analytiska förmåga, samt kunskaper i excel och flertal andra verktyg och IT-system som används i samband med en revision.
   

  

 ,
   

  

**Vi söker dig som:**
* Har en gymnasieexamen inriktning ekonomi med goda betyg
* Är flytande i svenska och bekväm med att arbeta på engelska, både i skrift och tal
* Har grundläggande kunskaper i Office-paketet, särskilt Excel
* Är kreativ, lösningsorienterad och arbetar prestigelöst
* Tar eget ansvar, är initiativtagande och har en stark känsla för service


 Du behöver inte ha tidigare erfarenhet.
   

  

**Vad erbjuder vi dig?**
 På KPMG får du möjlighet att utvecklas både personligt och professionellt. Vi betonar vikten av att arbeta i team samtidigt som vi uppmuntrar individens utveckling. Hos oss får du arbeta i en spännande miljö där du får möjlighet att bidra till innovativa lösningar för våra kunder. Tjänsten är ett tidsbegränsat uppdrag på 12 månader.
   

  

**Ansökan:** 
 Varmt välkommen med din ansökan bestående av CV, betyg och personligt brev. För mer information om tjänsten är du välkommen att kontakta oss.
   

  

 I första steget av rekryteringsprocessen använder vi kapacitetstester. Testerna används för att göra urvalsprocessen så objektiv som möjligt. Du kommer att få kapacitetstesterna skickade via e-post efter att du har skickat in din ansökan, och vi kommer inte att behandla din ansökan förrän testerna har slutförts. Om du inte har fått några tester inom fyra timmar efter din ansökan - vänligen kontakta den ansvariga rekryterare, anna.landar@kpmg.se.
   

  

 Varmt välkommen med din ansökan!

title: .Net SCADA Design Engineer
description:
**C++, EIS : SCADA Design and Development on GE Fanuc platform, Windows Presentation Foundation (For .NET 4.0), ASP.NET 4.5** 




 English Swedish Required
 



 Stockholm
 



 9 Month contract-Possible extension
 



 Hybrid
 



  





**Steel Mfg Experience Required** 




  





  





  





  





 The new system will be built upon Client plant platform for Level 2 systems called WL2 (Windows Level 2).
 



 The WL2 platform is built upon C# .Net 8, ASP .Net Core and WPF Core.
 



 Integrations to other systems are done using IBM MQ.
 



 Standard components and code re-used between the system are stored in Nuget packages that are used by each system.
 



 The requirement specifications and major design work will be done by internal Client Resources. Client will handle project management.
 



 During the project Azure Devops will be used for planning and tracking of status.
 



 Git is used as code repository.
 



 All team members are expected to use pull requests and do code reviews before code is being checked in.
 



 All team members are expected to follow the internal guidelines for how code should be written, mainly built upon Domain Driven Design and Microsoft best practices.
 



 C#, ASP.NET Core, WPF Core & industrial IT systems (SCADA/MES) in Steel manufacturing Background (Onsite)a.

title: Data Scientist Consultant
description:
**Are you passionate about data and the business value it can create? Look no further - Data Edge is the place to be!** 




  





 Our ambition is to create a leading consulting company in the intersection between Business development, Analytics and Data. In order to succeed with that we need great people that want constant learning, are curious, have high integrity and love teamwork. Above all, share our passion about creating lasting business value through data and analysis.
 



  





 We who work at Data Edge have many years of experience in data, analysis and data-driven transformation from leading consulting and tech companies and know what is needed to realize business value through data. Our ambition is to be the given choice for organizations that need to bridge the gap between business and technology, from strategy to implementation.
 



  





 At Data Edge, we strive to live by our values: Passion for Data, Integrity, and Teamwork.
 



  





**What We Offer** 




  




* The opportunity to be part of a team that is committed to developing within the field. We invest in our growth through initiatives such as internal knowledge sharing and participation in external seminars/events.
* A diverse range of challenges, both with clients and within our own company development. You will be instrumental in building a company where you will have significant impact and involvement.
* A clear niche and broad network that will ensure engaging and rewarding projects within the field.



  





**What We Are Looking For** 




  





 Below are some areas with concrete examples of the skills you need. The list does not cover all required skills, but it's impossible for one person to be an expert in everything.
 



  




* **Passion for Data and Analytics:** 
  You genuinely enjoy using data and analytics to solve real-world problems for our clients.
* **Business Understanding:** 
  You have a knack for understanding business problems, what drives business success, and have experience working in business development.
* **Experience:** 
  You have at least 3 years of employment as either a Data Scientist or a consultant in Data Science.
* **Analytical Skills:** 
  You have experience conducting a wide range of analyses of varying complexity across different industries and are eager to learn more.
* **Cloud Platforms:** 
  Experience with cloud platforms such as AWS, GCP, or Azure.
* **Cloud Computing & Modern Engineering Practices:** 
  Knowledge of cloud computing and modern engineering practices (e.g., version control, CI/CD, and Docker).
* **Programming Skills:** 
  Proficiency in programming languages such as Python, SQL, and experience in working with applied machine learning and generative AI.
* **Data Visualization & Communication:** 
 Ability to visualize complex data and clearly communicate insights to clients, making it actionable for business users.
* **Location & Eligibility:** 
  You are based in Stockholm and legally eligible to work in Sweden.
* **Interest in Building the Company:** 
  We also hope that you are interested in continuing to build Data Edge!



  





 If this sounds interesting to you, please reach out! In your application, we would love to hear about your strengths and how you fit the role, as well as areas where you’re looking to grow, given the above description. No one knows everything, but we constantly strive to develop our skills and remain humble about the breadth of expertise required to drive business value from data.

title: Experienced Industrial Engineer for End of Line Equipment, BATTERY PRODUCTION
description:
Scania is now undergoing a transformation from being a supplier of trucks, buses and engines to a supplier of complete and sustainable transport solutions.
   

  

 Scania's ambition is to be a leader in the shift towards sustainable transport solutions.
   

  

 In that ambition, electrification plays an important role!
   

  

 The battery project consists of the series production of battery packs and VCB cabling as well as existing prototype production. We are in the middle of a phase where we train and build competence to manufacture and develop these into tomorrow's products in e-mobility.
   

  

**Your mission**
 You will work as an Industrial Engineer for End of Line (EOL) equipment which is the Final station to ensure Quality of the Battery Module & Pack before leaving the factory.
   

  

 You, as an Industrial Engineer in Battery Module Project team, will be responsible for planning, coordinating and carrying out all Project related activities (Ex: PreStudy, Equipment Specification, RFQ, Procurement phase, Factory + Site acceptance test, Commissioning, Trials, SOP etc) for the EOL equipment modification for Next Generation Battery project.
   

  

 This is the EOL equipment at High Volume Series Production line for Battery Module & Pack, therefore we expect the candidate to be highly skilled in understanding the Technical aspects of EOL equipment along with good collaboration & Project management skills.
   

  

 Here in Scania, we have ‘state of art Production facility’ & one of the very few within Europe to Mass Produce Battery Modules & Packs for Electric Trucks.
   

  

**Your Responsibilities**
 The main responsibility in this role is to collaborate with several EOL Engineer/ Specialists, Equipment suppliers, Process Engineers, other Industrial engineers, R&D team, Logistics, IT team etc and drive the EOL equipment modification project following Scania’s Project management method.
   

  

 You will work with the Senior Project Manager & other Line Project Managers very closely to sync all project milestones.
   

  

**Exampels Of Other Responsibilities**
 Contribute to the development and improvement of quality control processes and procedures through working closely with the Quality team, EOL Engineers and R&D team.
   

  

 Maintain accurate and up-to-date records of updates requested to supplier based on modifications introduced by EOL engineers to the testing process.
   

  

**Who We Are Looking For - Your Profile**
 Since the person in this role will collaborate a lot with other functions, we are searching for a person who is very collaborative, agile, analytical, communicative, both in speech and in writing.
   

  

 We communicate both in English & Swedish, so good skills in English is required. Basic Swedish knowledge is required. Fluent Swedish is a plus.
   

  

 You need to pay attention to details and you have strong analytical skills. Problem solving and finding solutions is something you regard as nice challenges.
   

  

**Education**
 Higher technical education (Bachelors/ Masters degree) preferably Electrical engineering or a related field
   

  

**Experience**
* Basic understanding of battery technologies, electrical systems
* Understanding of the Equipment including Mechanical, Electrical drawings of the Equipment and Software.
* Experience of Project management in a Mass production setup.
* Knowledge about Equipment’s working method (PLC, HMIs, Solenoid, Motor’s working principle etc).
* Experience of Scania's PEIP process is a plus
* Exposure to CATIA (or similar) is a plus


**Your new employer**
 Scania’s culture is characterized by openness, diversity and respect for the individual. The people who work here are our most important asset, so we will invest in you to help you grow with us. As a Scania employee, you are offered several benefits in addition to personal and professional development opportunities. These benefits include mutual bonus, leasing car, occupational pension and flexible working hours.
   

  

**Additional Information**
 If you want to know more about the role, you are welcome to contact:
   

  

 EOL Specialist, Cecilia Mathe (cecilia.mathe@scania.com)
   

  

 Senior Project Manager, Julia Winter (julia.winter@scania.com)
   

  

 or Group Manager, Soumya Dipta Das (soumya.dipta.das@scania)
   

  

**Application**
 Your application must include a personal letter, CV, and grades. Scania is using tests as a part of the recruitment process. A background check may be done for this position. Selection and interviews will take place on an ongoing basis. Apply via scania.com/career as soon as possible, but not later than September 24th.

title: Accounting Associate (Accounts Payable)
description:
**COME WORK WITH US** 




 Netlight strives to be a truly diverse, equitable and inclusive organization. Regardless of who you are, what personality, background, and experience you have, you enrich our culture through your values. Netlight’s purpose is to unleash full potential, realize great careers, and fulfill personal growth. To achieve this, we have a highly engaged network organization, where every employee gets a mentor, delivery coach and personal communities. The key to our continued success is trust and personal responsibility, diverse experiences, challenging opportunities and developing from personal values. Every Netlighter is an active part of building and shaping this culture, which leads to a clear correlation between personal growth and the growth of Netlight.
 



  





**ABOUT US** 




 Netlight provides a full range of premium IT-consulting services at the forefront of the digital industry and stands out for its product- and technology-independent expertise in a wide range of industries and clients. We are a network organization of more than 2000 role models making aspiring digital leaders successful in their business-critical IT projects. Netlight has been awarded several times as top employer, as well as for growth, continued profitability and engagement for diversity, equity and equality within the IT industry. Today we are growing all across Europe, currently with more than 10 active international offices.
 



  





**THE ROLE** 




 We are looking for someone who wants to be part of our finance function in Sweden but also part of an international team spread across Europe. In your role as an accounts payable responsible for our Swedish company, you will have responsibility for financial tasks from A to Z.
 



  





 The position includes duties such as:
 



 - Handling supplier invoices and payments.
 



 - Communication with suppliers.
 



 - Reconciliation of accounts payable, bookkeeping and investigation.
 



 - Time-code approval.
 



 - Account reconciliations including bank reconciliation.
 



 - Streamlining routines and processes.
 



 - Expense handling.
 



 - Other administrative tasks.
 



  





**MINIMUM QUALIFICATIONS** 




 - We are looking for someone with relevant financial education.
 



 - Approximately 1-3 years of work experience in accounts payable and finance.
 



 - Verbal and written fluency in Swedish and English.
 



 - Excellent communication and people skills.
 



 - Curious and resourceful mindset.
 



 - Attention to detail and great organizational skills.
 



  





**WE OFFER** 




 A possibility to be a part of growing one of the most successful IT-consultancy companies in the industry. Competence development is core and realised through a culture of knowledge sharing, feedback, mentorship and coaching. An international working environment. Competitive and transparent salary and attractive benefits.
 



  





**GET IN TOUCH WITH US!** 




 The role is a full-time position commencing at the earliest possible opportunity. If we find that your profile matches what we are looking for, we will contact you shortly.
 



  





 Send in your application in English, including your CV.
 



  





 We are looking forward to your application!

title: Senior Level Designer - Games
description:
As a Senior Level Designer at Embark, your responsibility will be to create levels for unique and innovative high-quality 3D games. You will be collaborating closely with artists, game designers, and the rest of the game team to create engaging, world-class playgrounds, with an emphasis on large environments and worlds. From concept, through paper design, blockout and final polish. You will iterate to realize the best canvas for varied and interesting play, utilizing the full range of mechanics in your toolbox, including, for example, destruction, vehicles, character abilities, weapons and items, the game modes and their rules.
   

  

 As a designer you are curious and eager to embrace novel ideas and concepts (your own and others), and you enjoy fleshing out how new mechanics or player experiences can be incorporated and expanded upon in your levels. At the same time you are able to leverage your experience on “what works” for player navigation, moment-to-moment combat, flow, chokepoints and map control as well as keeping an eye on performance and how it is presented to players. You are an expert at analyzing, articulating and solving problems and strive to craft the best possible player experiences.
   

  

 In this role, you will work on ARC Raiders and as a senior member of the team, you will collaborate closely with the directors and leads of the project, in refining concepts and ideas into tangible designs, prototypes and features. As well as Production leadership helping in articulating and establishing estimates, project scope and timelines.
   

  

**Example Of Responsibilities**
* Be the gameplay champion for your levels and environments
* Widen the pool of player/world interactivity from a level design perspective
* Design, present, mock-up and iterate on levels and ideas for levels
* Work closely with the artists and tech to drive the aesthetics and performance of your levels
* Scripting and setting up game modes and other gameplay components on your levels
* Help to identify areas in which workflows or tools can be improved
* Responsive to player feedback, telemetry and live data to refine and hone the player experience and balance on your levels


**We would love if you have**
* A creative and curious mind!
* 4+ years of experience in similar role.
* Passion for and experience with high quality hands-on 3D game building.
* Proficiency with the Unreal Engine, level building and some blueprint/scripting experience.
* Experience from AAA live service and/or F2P games.
* Advocacy for the player experience and their creative involvement.
* Enjoyment of creative collaboration - eager to design and share with others.
* Some familiarity with coding practice, art pipelines and systems design.
* Professional English communication skills.


 At Embark we offer competitive salaries, passionate colleagues to share knowledge with and much more, but most of all we invite you to take part of a journey into the unknown, to build creative, surprising and beautiful experiences together.
   

  

 We welcome game makers of all sex, class, colour, age, gender identity, education, religion, opinion, culture, nation of origin, language, sexual orientation, shape, size, and ability.
   

  

 Did we leave anyone out? Well, we welcome you, too! We think that the gaming industry is made better when everyone has a seat at the table.
   

  

 Be yourself at Embark and make games while doing so. Please apply with confidence. We can’t wait to hear from you (in English)!
   

  

*If this role doesn't quite match what you're looking for, feel free to apply to us via our "* 
*Open Application.* 
*"*

title: Territory Account Manager, Sweden North
description:
What if the work you did every day could impact the lives of people you know? Or all of humanity?
   

  

 At Illumina, we are expanding access to genomic technology to realize health equity for billions of people around the world. Our efforts enable life-changing discoveries that are transforming human health through the early detection and diagnosis of diseases and new treatment options for patients.
   

  

 Working at Illumina means being part of something bigger than yourself. Every person, in every role, has the opportunity to make a difference. Surrounded by extraordinary people, inspiring leaders, and world changing projects, you will do more and become more than you ever thought possible.
   

  

**Territory Account Manager, Sweden North**
 As a Territory Account Manager, you will leverage your technical skills in life science along with commercial acumen to drive your ability to achieve sales objectives in alignment with the Company's mission. You will be eager to cultivate relationships with both existing and new customers, establishing yourself as a trusted partner and a crucial player in our Commercial business.
   

  

 Please note that this is a field-based position where you are required to be based in Sweden. The role requires a valid driving license, and you will be required to travel extensively within the region. It is essential for the role that the successful candidate has fluent/native Swedish and English language skills.
   

  

 Illumina's employee benefits are industry-leading and include flexible time off, compassion and care time off, leisure travel insurance, pension, employee stock purchasing program, annual equity plan, volunteer time off, and much more!
   

  

 Why You
   

  

 As our Territory Account Manager, you will have professional and strategic sales skills with an ability to develop and grow key accounts through networking at all levels of the customer organization. You will partner with an existing and evolving ecosystem of commercial partners at Illumina, such as sales specialists, legal, customer care and marketing. You will also have the ability to convert qualified leads into closed deals and build your own pipeline of leads.
   

  

**Preferred Background Experience**
* Develop high-value, long-term profitable customer accounts through relationship-building sales techniques.
* Identify and manage high-caliber sales opportunities through professional screening processes and use of all available information resources.
* Prepare compelling customer sales presentations and participate in all sales activities and assist with general customer demonstrations, training, and support.
* Negotiate all genetic analysis sales in the territory and generate associated sales contracts and quotations.
* Maintain profit margins through effective sales negotiation.
* Coordinate and communicate sales activities and strategies effectively.
* Develop and maintain all account/contact/opportunity details within Illumina’s CRM database.
* Leverage CRM system to grow sales from the existing customer base and expand the customer base in assigned territory.
* Provide regular and accurate sales forecast updates.
* Create a territory business plan that satisfies goals as established by sales management.
* Effectively build a short/medium/long-term sales pipeline and manage the necessary levels of sales leads, prospects, and opportunities.
* Satisfy all product and technology training requirements.


 Role Requirements
   

  

* Strong technical background in molecular biology or genomics is required.
* Experience in account management.
* Demonstrated experience in Life Science or Diagnostics sales.
* Excellent negotiation, time management, organizational, and interpersonal skills.
* Strong knowledge of the industry and the ability to understand clients' business objectives and challenges.
* Excellent written and verbal communication skills.
* Proficient in Microsoft Office Suite and CRM software.
* Ability to travel extensively for client meetings and industry events as required.
* Strong problem-solving skills and ability to think strategically.
* Proven ability to meet and exceed sales targets.
* PhD or MSc in Life Sciences.
* Fluent in Swedish and English.


 What Can You Expect
   

  

 Our team members are bright, energetic, and dedicated - they are the driving force behind our innovation and impact. To attract the best and brightest, we offer a competitive employee benefits program. We view it as a smart investment in our people, one that recognizes the tremendous value they bring to our business every day. At Illumina, we push boundaries. We think beyond the conventional. We dream big. With the energy of so many bright and accomplished people, the opportunities are endless.
   

  

 The mission of Illumina is to improve human health by the power of the genome.
   

  

 Illumina believes that everyone has the ability to make an impact, and we are proud to be an equal opportunities employer committed to providing employment opportunity regardless of sex, race, creed, color, gender, religion, marital status, domestic partner status, age, national origin or ancestry, physical or mental disability, medical condition, sexual orientation, pregnancy, military or veteran status, citizenship status, and genetic information.

title: Product Manager - Surgery
description:
**Job Description Summary**
 Join our dynamic team as a Nordic Product Manager for our Surgery portfolio, responsible for driving sustainable growth and implementing innovative marketing strategies across the Nordics. This role offers a unique opportunity to shape country business strategies while collaborating closely with internal and regional partners. This is a full-time position, and you will be traveling approximately 60-80% of the time including overnight stays to meet with Key Opinion Leaders. While your presence may be required in our Stockholm office, we offer flexibility with remote working arrangements to support your work-life balance and ensure maximum efficiency in achieving our goals.
   

  

 We consider offering relocation assistance for qualified candidates.
   

  

 Our vision for BD Interventional at BD
   

  

 BD Interventional (BDI) focus on leading innovation and life-enhancing devices in the field of surgical, endovascular, urological and critical care interventions aiming at advancing the treatment of high burden diseases and enabling surgical and interventional procedures.
   

  

**Job Description**
**We are the makers of possible**
 BD is one of the largest global medical technology companies in the world. Advancing the world of health™ is our Purpose, and it’s no small feat. It takes the imagination and passion of all of us—from design and engineering to the manufacturing and marketing of our billions of MedTech products per year—to look at the impossible and find transformative solutions that turn dreams into possibilities.
   

  

**Why join us?**
 A career at BD means learning and working alongside inspirational leaders and colleagues who are equally passionate and committed to fostering an inclusive, growth-centered, and rewarding culture. You will have the opportunity to help shape the trajectory of BD while leaving a legacy at the same time.
   

  

 To find purpose in the possibilities, we need people who can see the bigger picture, who understand the human story that underpins everything we do. We welcome people with the imagination and drive to help us reinvent the future of health. At BD, you’ll discover a culture in which you can learn, grow and thrive. And find satisfaction in doing your part to make the world a better place.
   

  

 Become a
 **maker of possible** 
 with us!
   

  

**Main Responsibilities Will Include**
* Develop and implement strategic plans for the surgical product portfolio in the Nordic region
* Conduct market research and analysis to identify customer needs, market trends, and competitive landscape
* Collaborate with cross-functional teams to define product requirements and specifications
* Drive product development and launch activities, ensuring timely delivery and successful market introduction
* Develop and implement marketing strategies to drive product adoption and market share growth
* Provide training and support to sales teams and customers on product features, benefits, and usage
* Build and maintain strong relationships with key opinion leaders, healthcare professionals, and industry associations
* Stay up-to-date with industry advancements, regulations, and standard processes to ensure compliance and competitive advantage


**About You**
* Bachelor’s degree in Science or Business, especially in Marketing.
* Minimum of 5 years of experience in product management or commercial position within the healthcare industry, preferably in surgical products
* Prior clinical experience in OP nursing, preferably in hernia is desired.
* Understanding of healthcare systems, influencing dynamics and data related the operational aspects of surgical procedures.
* Proficiency in managing tender processes and contract management.
* Experience in developing and implementing omnichannel marketing campaigns.
* Fluent in verbal and written Swedish/Norwegian and English


**Click on apply if this sounds like you!**
 Becton, Dickinson and Company is an Equal Opportunity/Affirmative Action Employer. We do not unlawfully discriminate on the basis of race, color, religion, age, sex, creed, national origin, ancestry, citizenship status, marital or domestic or civil union status, familial status, affectional or sexual orientation, gender identity or expression, genetics, disability, military eligibility or veteran status, or any other protected status.
   

  

**To learn more about BD visit:** 
**https://bd.com/careers**
 Primary Work Location
   

  

 SWE Stockholm - Marieviksgatan
   

  

 Additional Locations
   

  

 Work Shift
   

  

 SE PT (Sweden)

title: Senior Clinical Research Associate
description:
**Job Description**
**Senior Clinical Research Associate (SrCRA)**
**About The Position**
 We are currently looking for a highly skilled and motivated SrCRA to share our mission to execute clinical research in an innovative, efficient, high quality and compliant manner to improve and save lives around the world.
   

  

 As a SrCRA you will be employed by Our Company in Sweden and part of an engaged team ensuring excellence in our clinical trials and site performance. Clinical Research at Our Company is given top priority and is a cornerstone of the business. Consequently, you will as a SrCRA have considerable responsibility and play an important part in ensuring successful clinical trials. While you as SrCRA will be under the oversight of a Country Lead Clinical Research Manager, you are accountable for performance and compliance for assigned protocols and sites as primary site contact and site manager.
   

  

 Finally, as one of our self-driven and resourceful SrCRAs you will be actively developing and expanding the territory for clinical research – including finding and developing new sites and engaging with internal and external stakeholders.
   

  

**About You**
 We are looking for a new colleague who is eager to learn and who does not shy away from a challenge. Our new colleague will be part of a fast-paced team full of positive and experienced people. We expect you to contribute strongly to the CRA team knowledge by acting as Subject Matter Expert, sharing best practices, making recommendations for continuous improvement and providing training as appropriate/required.
   

  

 Furthermore, we are looking for the following core competencies in our new colleague
   

  

* Fluent in both Swedish and English and excellent communication skills, including the ability to understand and present technical information effectively
* Excellent understanding and working knowledge of clinical research, phases of clinical trials, current GCP/ICH, country clinical research law and global/country/regional clinical research guidelines and ability to work within these guidelines
* Proven skills in site management and monitoring including independent management of site performance and patient recruitment, and professional judgment
* Experience with conducting site motivational visit designed to boost site enrollment
* Advanced IT-skills (use of MS office, use of various clinical IT applications on computer, tablet and mobile devices) and ability to adapt to new IT applications on various devices
* Capable of managing complex issues, works in a solution-oriented manner
* High sense of accountability / urgency. Ability to set priorities and handle multiple tasks simultaneously in a changing environment.
* Capable of leading and mentoring CRAs on process/study requirements
* Works effectively in a multicultural environment. Ability to establish and maintain culturally sensitive working relationships.
* Ability to travel domestically and internationally approx. 50% of their working time
* Holds a valid driver’s license


**Experience Requirements**
* Four years of experience with direct site management in pharma/bio/CRO
* Bachelor’s degree with strong emphasis in science and/or biology


 We are proud to be a company that embraces the value of bringing diverse, talented, and committed people together. The fastest way to breakthrough innovation is when diverse ideas come together in an inclusive environment. We encourage our colleagues to respectfully challenge one another’s thinking and approach problems collectively. We are an equal opportunity employer, committed to fostering an inclusive and diverse workplace.
   

  

 Current Employees apply HERE
