title: Principal Product Manager
description:
As a Principal Product Manager in ZEOS, Zalando’s B2B Logistics unit developing fulfillment solutions, you will be part of an experience product domain, enabling a seamless merchant experience across ZEOS’s fulfilment and emerging digital offerings. You and the team will play a pivotal role in designing and developing the ZEOS One portal providing merchants with a one-stop-shop experience grounded in data and insights, to enable them to manage their operations and steer growth end-to-end.
   

  

 You will be working with a cross-functional team of Product Managers, Designers, User Researchers and Engineers owning the end-to-end merchant journey. This is a highly collaborative role, you will partner closely with Product, Commercial and Operations teams within ZEOS, as well as teams across other parts of the business to drive the roadmap. You will set the vision for creating simple, compelling and user-centric digital experiences through deep user insights.
   

  

**WHAT WE’D LOVE YOU TO DO (AND LOVE DOING)**
* You'll play a key role in executing the product vision and roadmap for Europe’s most customer-centric fulfilment platform that connects any fashion brand with customers anytime, anywhere
* You’ll co-create the product vision for our ZEOS One portal and define the corresponding product strategy and roadmap
* You’ll align merchant-facing capabilities to business goals and target merchant experience
* You’ll coach and work closely with Senior Product Managers in the merchant experience domain building common experience capabilities
* You’ll support your and other product teams to deliver a highly usable and valuable merchant journey across the ZEOS One portal
* You'll define KPIs for your area and support and inspire our teams to achieve these goals, with a focus on merchant satisfaction and engagement
* You will understand how the KPIs impact our merchant experience and business performance long-term and monitor success over time
* You'll collaborate with an extended network of internal and external stakeholders to scope, prioritize and solve the highest impact merchant experience opportunities


****WE’D LOVE TO MEET YOU IF…****
* You have at least 5 years of experience developing B2C (consumer-facing) or B2B (enterprise-grade) products and features across multiple experience domains
* You are end user-focused and love to solve complex client or customer problems
* You are motivated by discovering and developing valuable, useable and feasible solutions for clients or customers
* You are a data-driven and collaborative Product Management practitioner
* You have previous experience working on user interface design and/or defining transformative user experiences
* You have excellent verbal and written communication skills and the ability to translate technical functionality into relatable features across multiple teams, align goals and deliverables and drive overall success independent of organizational boundaries
* You have experience owning the long and medium term vision and development roadmap for products. You have driven products which have a multi-year horizon for realization of the full vision
* You are excited about complex problems, show grit and curiosity at tackling them, while inspiring others
* You know how to measure the success of your product and continuously iterate to improve it for the benefit of our partners


**OUR OFFER**
 Zalando provides a range of benefits,here’s an overview of what you can expect
   

  

  

* Employee shares program
* 40% off fashion and beauty products sold and shipped by Zalando, 30% off Zalando Lounge, discounts from external partners
* 2 paid volunteering days a year
* Hybrid working model, with flexible hours and up to 60% remote
* Work from abroad for up to 30 working days a year
* 27 days of vacation a year to start
* Relocation assistance available (subject to prior agreement)
* Family services, including counseling and support
* Health and wellbeing options (including Gympass)
* Mental health support and coaching available
* Drive your development through our training platform and biannual peer-to-peer review


 Please ask your Talent Acquisition Partner to learn more about what we offer.
   

  

**About Zalando**
 It’s the perfect time to join Zalando on our journey, from being a pioneer in the world of e-commerce, to the starting point for fashion in Europe. We connect customers, brands, and partners across 23 markets.
   

  

 Help us drive digital and sustainable solutions for fashion, logistics, advertising and research, bringing head-to-toe fashion to almost 49 million active customers through a team of diverse skill-sets, cultural backgrounds, and interests.
   

  

 Our values https //jobs.zalando.com/en/our-founding-mindset
   

  

 do.More - our sustainability strategy https //corporate.zalando.com/en/sustainability
   

  

 Follow us on Instagram instagram.com/insidezalando
   

  

**About ZEOS Https //zeos.eu/our-story**
 Please note that all applications must be completed using the online form - we do not accept applications via email.

title: German speaking Sales Development Representative to IamIP!

title: Ab Initio Lead Developer
description:
What makes Cognizant a unique place to work? The combination of rapid growth and an international and innovative environment! This is creating a lot of opportunities for people like YOU — people with an entrepreneurial spirit who want to make a difference in this world.
   

  

 At Cognizant, together with your colleagues from all around the world, you will collaborate on creating solutions for the world's leading companies and help them become more flexible, more innovative and successful. And this is your chance to be part of the success story: we are looking for an Ab Initio Lead Developer to join our Team.
   

  

**Roles & Responsibilities**
 Understanding business & technical requirements, and contribute to the design, concentrate on the pure technical solution, and implement ETL Data integrations using Ab Initio.
   

  

 Interact with clients and internal stakeholders, provide guidance to team members and execute projects through the course of coding, quality control, deployment, maintenance and support in order to deliver the project on time by ensuring maximum application uptime WITHIN the limits of SLAs, Cognizant and clients standards, processes and policies.
   

  

 Project Planning and Set-up. Understand project scope Based on the analysis of the type of the project provide inputs on project methodology to senior stakeholders (Project Manager / Architects etc.) Consolidate inputs from developers and collectively provide inputs on activities/ tasks, task level estimates, schedule, dependencies, risks etc. Consolidate inputs from developers and collectively provide inputs to testing strategy, configuration, deployment, hardware/software requirement etc. Analyse in detail resources required for every phase, conduct estimation of time utilization of different resources and activities, prepare resource and development plan, or provide inputs and review with PM Participate in KT sessions conducted by customer/ other business teams.
   

  

**Requirement understanding and Analysis**
 Along with the Business Analyst, gather requirements (functional and non-functional) from customer Analyse requirements for feasibility with regards to testing and implementation Provide inputs for requirements prioritization Debrief team on the requirements gathered and seek feedback Participate in client calls and seek clarifications if any Create and maintain requirements traceability matrix along with BA Provide inputs during creation of operational concepts and scenarios Work with administrators to setup security requirements
   

  

**Design**
 Understand various functional and non-functional requirements and HLD in order to provide inputs to create LLD and review Recommend make/ buy or alternate solutions Provide inputs in designing end to end solution.
   

  

**Experience And Qualification**
* Hands-on Ab Initio experience (atleast 6-8 years) in working with big data, data lake platforms will be preferred. Total IT experience can be between 12 to 15 year.
* Ability to understand & comprehend data flows for Data Lake implementation.
* Experience in Analysis, Design, Development, Testing and Deployment in Enterprise-level ETL development using Ab Initio GDE
* Exposure to BigData technologies (overall understanding) including partitioning in Hadoop, Hadoop file formats (avro,orc), Hive. Experience in using Ab Initio for reading/writing to HDFS.


**What You Can Expect**
* Become part of a ‘flag ship’ success story - We go through enormous growth
* Organization driven by technology – We have a tremendous technology backbone
* Open, ‘can do’ team spirit
* Environment where you can make your own ideas reality
* Drive your own career
* Market conform benefits #Mgr

title: Key Account Manager Partners till Euro Accident
description:
Försäkringar och hälsa är en vinnande kombination! Genom tidiga insatser, samarbete med kompetenta partners och smarta digitala tjänster har vi på Euro Accident fått saker att hända. Med vårt erbjudande har försäkring gått från att bara vara ekonomisk ersättning till att bidra till livskvalité och Hållbara medarbetare. Idag har nästan en halv miljon kunder trygghet genom oss. Vi är stolta över våra nöjda kunder och samarbetspartners, vårt goda rykte och den insats vi gör för samhället. Nu avancerar vi för att kunna hjälpa ännu fler och söker dig som vill vara med på vår fortsatta framgångssaga.
   

  

 Nu söker vi en Key Account Manager som, genom att bidra med driv, struktur, nytänkande och framåtanda kan fortsätta stärka vår framgång på marknaden.
   

  

**Om rollen**
 Som Key Account Manager Partners, har du affärsansvar för ett antal etablerade samarbeten inom ett av våra strategiskt viktiga områden. Rollen innefattar även etablering och implementering av nya partnersamarbeten. Teamet består av 12 drivna och sammansvetsade personer fördelat på fem orter runt om i Sverige.
   

  

 Förutom att driva försäljning och hitta nya spännande samarbeten så kommer du också att vara starkt bidragande till att fortsätta förädla samarbetet med andra avdelningar som t.ex. kundservice och produktavdelningen, för att på bästa sätt möta våra ovärderliga samarbetspartners. Vidare kommer du:
   

  

* Arbeta målstyrt på individuell och teambasis
* Ansvara för att dina samarbeten utvecklas i linje med bolagets mål och samordna önskemål och behov i affären
* Arbeta tillsammans med övriga bolaget för att på bästa sätt möta våra samarbetspartners framtida behov
* Driva utveckling inom bolaget för att säkra framtida tillväxt
* Framförallt ha otroligt kul på jobbet


 Tjänsten är placerad i Stockholm där du utgår från vårt fina kontor i Mörby C, Danderyd.
   

  

**Vårt erbjudande**
 När vi bidrar till en trygg och frisk värld börjar vi på våra egna kontor. Vi vill att du ska ha en sund balans mellan arbete och privatliv och vi värnar om arbetsglädjen och vår unika kultur där omtanke, handlingskraft och nytänkande är våra ledord i vardagen. Utöver förmånlig tjänstepension och ett flexibelt arbetsliv, innehåller vart omfattande förmånspaket bland annat sjuk- och sjukvårdsförsäkring, samtalsstöd, ett generöst friskvårdsbidrag, möjlighet till träning och massage på arbetstid och gemensam frukost varje dag samt andra sociala aktiviteter i sann EA¬spirit!
   

  

**Om dig**
 Vi söker dig som har god erfarenhet av att driva försäljning och som delar våra värderingar; omtanke, handlingskraft och nytänkande. Du har en mycket god kommunikativ förmåga och är en sann teamplayer som motiveras av att bidra till vår gemensamma framgång. För att trivas i rollen bör du vara prestigelös och öppen med driv och vilja att uppnå goda resultat och framgång. Du har förmåga att inte bara agera i nuet, utan också kunna blicka framåt, planera och agera därefter. Vidare är du en person som värderar processer, strukturer och gillar frihet under ansvar. Du har:
   

  

* Flerårig erfarenhet inom bank/försäkringsområdet
* Bakgrund och förståelse från liv-/personriskförsäkring, och externt förmedlad affär
* Stor erfarenhet av att driva försäljning
* En stark vilja och driv att hjälpa våra samarbetspartners att växa
* Mycket goda kunskaper inom socialförsäkringssystemet
* Mycket goda kunskaper i svenska och engelska i tal och skrift.


 På Euro Accident är det vi medarbetare som bygger framgång. Personliga egenskaper och förmågor är alltid en viktig komponent när vi söker nya medarbetare.
   

  

**Välkommen med din ansökan**
 Om du har frågor om tjänsten är du välkommen att kontakta rekryterande chef Robert Reinart enligt kontaktuppgifter nedan. Urval och intervjuer sker löpande så ansök redan idag!
   

  

 För att främja objektivitet i urvalsprocessen använder vi arbetspsykologiska tester tidigt i processen och ber dig att svara på våra urvalsfrågor istället för att bifoga ett personligt brev.
   

  

*Vänligen notera att vi inte tar emot ansökningar via mejl med anledning av GDPR.*
**Om Euro Accident** 
 Euro Accident är ett svenskt livförsäkringsbolag med verksamhet på marknaderna i Sverige, Norge och Danmark. Företaget grundades 1996 och har i dag över 2,4 miljarder svenska kronor i årlig premievolym och över 400 medarbetare. Vi är specialister på risk-, grupp- och sjukvårdsförsäkringar och att förhindra eller åtgärda långa sjukskrivningar med insatser inom våra försäkringar. Våra kunder är företag och organisationer som tecknar våra olika försäkringar för sina medarbetare och medlemmar genom försäkringsförmedlare och partners. Vårt huvudkontor ligger i Stockholm. En del av vår it-verksamhet finns även på kontoret i Belgrad. I Göteborg, Köpenhamn, Malmö, Oslo, Växjö och Örnsköldsvik finns lokala kontor för administration, försäljning och kundservice för respektive marknad. Tillsammans skapar vi Hållbara medarbetare

title: Key Account Manager Transplant Nordic
description:
* Location: Sweden


**About The Job**
 We are seeking a highly motivated person to be part of this newly built North Europe Transplant franchise, eager to build up excellent relationships with the transplant centres and all the stakeholders involved in chronic Graft-vs-Host Disease management within the Nordics.
   

  

 Reporting to the Head of Transplant North Europe, this role is strategically positioned to realize the ambition for the Transplant franchise and to contribute to the overall future success of Sanofi.
   

  

 You will play a crucial role in the pre-launch planning and engagement activities, developing and executing customer-focused plans for the Transplant Centres within your scope. After launch, you are responsible for achieving the defined sales targets.
   

  

**Main responsibilities:**
**Pre-Launch (Q4 2024-Q3 2026)**
* Identifies key stakeholders in each of the Transplant Centres within Scope and develops an appropriate engagement plan aligned to their needs
* Conducts in-depth profiling of key Haematologist-Oncologists involved in chronic Graft-vs-Host Disease Management
* Develops customer-focused plans aligned to the brand strategy
* Builds Sanofi image/reputation in the Transplantation field
* Orchestrates the unbranded campaign, leveraging Sanofi channels to raise awareness for better management of prevention, implementation of treatment and monitoring of transplant patients in geographical area
* Strengthens mastery of disease and product through HCP engagements in key congresses and scientific meetings
* Develop a valuable relationship with healthcare professionals based on quality medical information and an ethical approach in compliance with the regulatory framework
* Participates in local and international internal and external meetings as required


**Launch (Q3 2026 onwards)**
* Responsible for the sales goals and qualitative performance parameters in the assigned area
* Develops and implements commercial, customer-focused projects to optimize patient care in collaboration with our key customers
* In close collaboration with Medical, Customer Engagement and other relevant functions, identifies, plans and executes projects aligned to the brand strategy
* Organizes local symposia and workshops with the key customers (HCPs, Nurses, Transplant Center stakeholders)
* Participates in in local, national and international meetings and symposia
* Ensures compliance within all activities to maintain the highest standards of patients focused ethical conduct in line with our values.
* Consistently ensures operating in accordance with Sanofi’s Code of conduct and all applicable local laws and regulations.


**About You**
* 5+ years of qualified work experience as a commercial representative in the Specialty care area (haematology, oncology, transplant, immunology)
* Preferably specific knowledge and network in Transplantation, or Haematology-Oncology, especially with regards to key customers


**Technical skills** 
 :
   

  

* Demonstrated customer engagement, project management and digital competencies
* Strong drive to deliver results while working collaboratively within a cross-functional team
* Can work autonomously, learn fast, and work in an agile manner
* Demonstrated entrepreneurial mindset
* Proven track record of success in various field-based sales roles
* Deep understanding of care pathway operational aspects
* A solution-oriented mindset enabling effective and creative problem-solving with customers' needs as a primary focus
* Expertise in clinical data, disease education and diagnostics
* Strong commercial business acumen, strategic thinking
* Digital & Analytical skills: able to analyze data, feedback and turn it into insights
* Must achieve and maintain compliance with all applicable regulatory, legal, and operational rules and procedures, and require the same of his/her team
* Willingness to travel (min. 80% customer facing activities), valid driver ‘s license


**Languages** 
 :
   

  

* Fluently in both verbal and written English and local language


**Soft skills** 
 :
   

  

* Excellent interpersonal and communication skills, with the ability to effectively engage internal and external stakeholders, build and cultivate strong working relationships
* Outstanding networking capabilities with strong negotiating skills
* Ability to develop organizational capabilities while influencing others
* Ability to prioritize multiple projects
* Ability to work agile, demonstrate creativity and be a strong team player
* Self-driven, results-oriented with ambition for optimal results
* Ability to dynamically adjust priorities due to changing circumstances
* Agile learner who is comfortable operating in complex environments


**Why choose us?**
* Bring the miracles of science to life alongside a supportive, future-focused team
* Discover endless opportunities to grow your talent and drive your career, whether it’s through a promotion or lateral move, at home or internationally
* Enjoy a thoughtful, well-crafted rewards package that recognizes your contribution and amplifies your impact
* Drive implementation science, powerful crowdsourcing and open innovation , discovering the ways to bring science to live faster , contributing to a patient first mindset
* Take good care of yourself and your family, with a wide range of health and wellbeing benefits including high-quality healthcare, prevention and wellness programs and at least 14 weeks’ gender-neutral parental leave


**Pursue** 
*Progress* 
 .
 **Discover** 
*Extraordinary* 
 .
   

  

 Progress doesn’t happen without people – people from different backgrounds, in different locations, doing different roles, all united by one thing: a desire to make miracles happen. You can be one of those people. Chasing change, embracing new ideas and exploring all the opportunities we have to offer. Let’s pursue progress. And let’s discover extraordinary together.
   

  

 At Sanofi, we provide equal opportunities to all regardless of race, color, ancestry, religion, sex, national origin, sexual orientation, age, citizenship, marital status, disability, or gender identity.
   

  

 Watch our ALL IN video and check out our Diversity Equity and Inclusion actions at sanofi.com!
   

  

 Pursue
 *progress* 
 , discover
 *extraordinary*
 Better is out there. Better medications, better outcomes, better science. But progress doesn’t happen without people – people from different backgrounds, in different locations, doing different roles, all united by one thing: a desire to make miracles happen. So, let’s be those people.
   

  

 At Sanofi, we provide equal opportunities to all regardless of race, colour, ancestry, religion, sex, national origin, sexual orientation, age, citizenship, marital status, ability or gender identity.
   

  

 Watch our ALL IN video and check out our Diversity Equity and Inclusion actions at sanofi.com!

title: Account Manager, Shops
description:
**About The Opportunity**
**From groceries and flowers to dog food and phone chargers—these days, you can order just about anything through the Foodora app. This level of convenience is made possible by the expertise of our Local Shops team. We're currently on the lookout for our next superstar Account Manager to join this dynamic group. In this role, you'll be the key ingredient in nurturing and strengthening relationships with our existing partners, ensuring that every collaboration becomes a mutual success story! If you want to be a part of reshaping the way people do their shopping, now is your time!**
**Your mission**
 Join our team and create an impact in the quick commerce revolution! We partner with retailers across various industries, with a strong focus on grocery partnerships. In this role, you'll manage a dynamic portfolio of local businesses from the largest brands in the grocery sector
   

  

* Educate our partners within quick commerce, analyze their performance on our platform and set a joint plan for future success
* Develop successful collaborations with partners in your portfolio with primary focus on order and revenue growth
* Create and celebrate great results


 We are looking for a true professional who enjoys working in a dynamic environment and is eager to elevate our team. To thrive in this role, you'll need to
 **bring loads of energy and drive** 
 — we are not just closing deals, we are creating new consumer behaviors and we need you to take it to the next level!
 **Cooperation** 
 is our secret sauce, and we believe that effective teamwork turns prospects into partners. Your
 **solution-oriented** 
 mindset allows you to see a new approach instead of the bumps in the road. If you’re
 **responsible** 
 and capable of juggling multiple tasks without dropping the ball, you’ll fit right in. Since you’ll be collaborating with various partners,
 **building and maintaining strong relationships** 
 will be your bread and butter, driving our collective success
   

  

 Our selection process is continuous and the ad may close before the recruitment process is completed, if we’ve moved forward to the screening or interview phase.
   

  

**Our recruitment process will include the following:**
 📞 Telephone interview - Let’s cover the basics!
   

  

 💡 Psychometric tests via Alva Labs - We use science-based methodology.
   

  

 🤝 First interview - Time to know each other a bit better!
   

  

 💼 Case interview - Do your magic and show us your skills!
   

  

 ✔️ Reference- & background check - Final step before we’ll become colleagues.
   

  

**Start date:** 
 Upon agreement
   

  

**What you need to be successful**
* Approx 2 years of working within b2b sales with good result
* Fluent in Swedish and very good skills in English
* You have a driver's license
* Any experience from working with or within FMCG is a big plus.


 Studies have shown that women and some minorities are less likely to apply to jobs unless they meet every qualification. If you are interested in this role and you have most of the skills we’re looking for, we encourage you to apply anyway!
   

  

**Who we are**
 ABOUT FOODORA: foodora is a quick commerce and delivery company, present in six countries in Europe - Austria, Czech, Hungary, Finland, Norway and Sweden. With the mission to deliver an amazing, fast and affordable experience, foodora aims to give customers more time to focus on what matters most to them, as well as growing along with their partners, riders and community along the way. foodora is part of Delivery Hero, a pioneer quick commerce company, building the next generation of e-commerce across its operations in over 70 countries across Asia, Europe, Latin America, the Middle East and Africa.
   

  

 For more information, please visit www.foodora.com
   

  

 foodora is part of the Delivery Hero Group, the world’s leading local delivery platform operating in 70+ countries worldwide
   

  

**What's in it for you**
* Wellness allowance topped with the opportunity to participate in many work/life balance initiatives at foodora such as free group training at Sats & reduced price on massage.
* Employee discount at foodora (woho!) and awesome friday breakfasts!
* Occupational pension, incl. premium exemption insurance, accident insurance and life insurance.
* foodora Learning - Monthly learning sessions about different topics, such as the q-commerce industry, negotiation techniques and project management combined with a structured onboarding and inspiring courses within our learning tool Sana
* Great deals at Benify (for e.g. gym membership, e-bikes hotels, audiobooks, streaming services, clothes, kitchen supplies… and so much more!
* Awesome AW’s and (pink) parties!

title: IT Product Specialist - SAP SuccessFactors and HR tools
description:
Join OX2 and use your skills to power the great shift towards a sustainable future. OX2 is a professional and ambitious company committed to accelerating access to renewable energy to speed up the transition to clean energy. We are multi-specialists to the core, offering a dynamic and inspiring workplace that enables seamless, cross-functional collaboration to achieve optimal results. At OX2 we empower you to take action, giving you the freedom and accountability to make great things happen and make a lasting impact.
 



  





 OX2’s IT-organization is growing, and we are now hiring an IT Product Specialist, responsible for SAP SuccessFactors and tools supporting the enabling functions, to be part of the exciting journey that we have ahead of us. You will play an important part in designing, implementing, and maintaining our HR tools and systems and more.
 



  





**About the position** 




 OX2 has expand geographically into new markets and with new technologies which has necessitated reviewing and developing innovative solutions. In the role of IT Product Specialist for SAP SuccessFactors, you will be ultimately responsible for the system's functionality and security, as well as ensuring efficient end-to-end processes across platforms where HR data is involved. You will be responsible for creating and maintaining the product backlog in JIRA, prioritizing user stories together with the Business Process Expert from HR and ensuring that development teams understand the deliverables. You will ensure that prioritized change requests are implemented, manage and monitor reported errors, and collaborate with other product areas.
 



  





 The role also includes executing service requests, following up on maintenance work, and ensuring that software updates and security upgrades are promptly made. Security management is a crucial part of the role, where you will ensure that systems comply with the IT security framework, conduct security audits, and test backup and recovery procedures. Documentation in Confluence and monitoring system performance with SIEM tools are also part of the responsibilities. The role includes staying updated with industry trends, participating in training, and testing new system functionality. The IT Product Specialist is part of the IT team, and you will report to Product Area Owner.
 



  





**Your responsibilities will include:** 



* Further develop OX2’s HR tools and systems as well as other tools used by our enabling functions
* Together with the Business Process Expert, own the Roadmap of SAP SuccessFactors and manage the backlog.
* Execute decisions and actively prioritize tasks in the area of SAP SuccessFactors and other enabling tools.
* Create and maintain the product backlog in JIRA and prioritize user stories.
* Manage software updates, patches, and security upgrades with the suppliers.
* Lead testing and release of error fixes.
* Follow up on regular maintenance work by suppliers and track performance against key KPIs and SLAs.
* Collaborate with other product areas to build cross-platform functionality as well as resolving cross-functional issues.
* Ensure systems comply with OX2’s IT security framework.
* Stay up to date with industry trends and advancements in SAP SuccessFactors.



  





**Sound like you?** 




 We want to hire someone who has genuine interest and documented experience in leading the development of HR tools and systems. A prerequisite for the job is that you have broad technical competence. As an IT Product Specialist - SAP SuccessFactors you have a key role in realizing and further developing OX2's strategies in the area. In addition, you have:
 



  




* Earlier working experience from similar roles as IT Product Specialist
* Proven experience with SAP SuccessFactors.
* Understanding of IT security frameworks and eager to learn more.
* Proficiency in JIRA and Confluence or similar ITSM tools.
* Familiarity with SIEM tools for system performance monitoring.
* Excellent problem-solving skills and attention to detail.
* Project management skills.
* Relevant education such as Computer science and System administration, or similar achieved knowledge and skills through work experience.
* Excellent verbal and written communication skills in English and Swedish.



  





 We attach great importance to personal qualities and are looking for you who have high ability to take initiatives, high driving capability and sense of responsibility for your own work. You are service minded and have strong interpersonal skills and enjoys working with a wide range of contacts. You are structured and able to understand the details as well as seeing the greater picture. The successful candidate will have a positive attitude, are pedagogical and have good communication skills.
 



  





**Does this sound interesting? We welcome your application!** 




 If you have questions about the position, you are welcome to contact Charlotta Skogar at charlotta.skogar@novare.se or 0761-66 48 78. Interviewing is taking place continuously so please send your application as soon as possible.

title: Vi söker engagerade studenter för kommande administrativa roller!
description:
Är du redo att ta dina första steg mot en karriär full av möjligheter? Drömmer du om att utveckla dina färdigheter samtidigt som du ger förstklassig service? Då kan vi ha tjänsten för dig!
   

 Just nu letar vi efter administratörer för kommande uppdrag tillsammans med våra kunder. Om du är redo att utvecklas inom administrativa världen, så är detta din chans! Dessa kommande tjänster är för dig som är student och letar efter ett flexibelt deltidsjobb som passar ditt studieschema.
   

  

 I denna roll kommer du att inta en central plats i våra kunders administrativa verksamheter. Här kommer du hantera olika administrativa uppgifter och vara en pålitlig stöttepelare i deras arbete. Det kan röra sig från allt till ekonomi, marknadsföring och sälj, men även IT.
   

  

 Du kommer bli anställd av oss på StudentConsulting, men arbeta tillsammans med vår kund. Du får möjlighet att snabbt vässa dina kunskaper och ta första steget mot en givande karriär.
   

  

**Detta Söker Vi**
 Vi letar efter dig som studerar på eftergymnasial nivå om minst 50%. Att ha tidigare erfarenhet inom administration eller kundtjänst är ett stort plus. Viktigast av allt, vi behöver att du är flytande på svenska och engelska.
   

  

 Vi ser gärna att du studerar inom eknomi, marknadsföring eller civilingenjör.
   

  

 För att blomstra i denna roll ser vi dig som en entusiastisk, målinriktad individ med en passion för service. Du är inte rädd för att ta initiativ och är van att slutföra uppgifter effektivt. Att jobba i grupp är något du trivs med, men du är också självgående när det krävs. Dessutom, du är extremt stresstålig och har en öga för detaljer, eftersom administrativa uppgifter kommer vara en del av vardagen.
   

 Har du frågor om tjänsten?
   

  

 Julia Edholm eller någon annan i Team Sthlm White Collar svarar gärna på dina frågor och funderingar.

title: Azure Architect
description:
**Role:**  

We are now looking for an Azure Architect. You will be responsible for designing and implementing cloud-based high availability SaaS solutions using Microsoft Azure services.

**Azure Platform Knowledge**


You should have a deep understanding of the Azure platform, including its various services, deployment models, and architectural best practices. This includes knowledge of :

* Azure Apps & Containers; Azure App Service, Azure Functions, Container registries, API Management, Event Hubs
* Azure Storages; Data Lake, Blob storages
* Azure Databases; Azure SQL, Redis, Cosmos DB
* Azure Security and identities; Key Vaults, Managed identities, Azure AD B2C / Entra External ID, Microsoft Defender
* Azure Networking; Private endpoints, Front Door
* Internet of Things; MQTT, Azure IoT Hub, Device Twins




**Solution Design**


You should be able to design scalable, reliable, and secure cloud solutions that meet the specific requirements of your organization or clients. This involves analyzing business needs, selecting appropriate Azure services, defining the architecture, and creating architectural diagrams and documentation.

**Cloud Migration and Integration**


You should be experienced in migrating on-premises applications and infrastructure to Azure, as well as integrating cloud services with existing systems. This requires understanding hybrid cloud architectures, data migration strategies, and integration patterns like messaging, event-driven architectures, and API management.

**Security and Compliance**


You should have knowledge of Azure security features and best practices, including identity and access management, encryption, network security, and compliance requirements such as GDPR, HIPAA, and ISO 27001. Understanding Microsoft Entra and Azure CIAM solutions (AAD), Microsoft Defender and Azure Security Center is important for ensuring secure and compliant solutions.

**Monitoring and Performance Optimization**


You should be familiar with Azure monitoring, diagnostic and alerting tools to monitor the health, performance, and availability of each used service and to handle required actions to keep the services available.

**DevOps and Testing**


You should have experience in implementing DevOps practices and using Azure DevOps or other similar work planning tool.


You should be experienced using GIT version control and branching strategies and utilizing Azure DevOps or other CI/CD tools to enable continuous integration, delivery, and deployment of cloud applications. You should have understanding of testing strategies and implementations including unit tests, UI and integration test automations and load testing to keep the solutions stable and available.  

  

**Please explain how you meet all the requirements** **when applying.**  

  

**Utilization****:** 100**%**  

**Location:** Remote  

**Period**: 16-09-2024-31-12-2025  

**Last day to apply**: 08-09-2024  

We present regularly. This means that we sometimes remove the assignements from our website before the final application deadline. If you are interested in an assignement, we recommend that you submit your application as soon as possible.

title: Senior DevOps Engineer
description:
Cambio is one of the Nordics' leading suppliers in e-health with a comprehensive offering for the entire health and care chain. Our e-health solutions support healthcare professionals in their daily work and offer patients safer and more easily accessible care. We are proud to be an important part of Swedish health and social care. We are growing continuously and now have about 1000 employees in several countries.

**The position**


Cambio has built an organization to deliver our products as a service. We are now looking for a Senior DevOps Engineer who wants to join our IT Infrastructure & Operations team and be part of deploying and improving the infrastructure for what is Sweden's largest electronic health record (EHR).


You will work in a team of experienced professionals driving the key Microsoft platforms for our customers. As a DevOps Engineer, you will be responsible for maintaining and building the technical infrastructure and IT systems that support our products and services. You will also be responsible for implementing DevOps best practices and collaborating with development teams to improve the software delivery process.


You will be working with designing and improving the services that we provide to the organization. You will also be working on automating, maintaining, and supporting our system, such as Bitbucket, Gitlab, Jenkins, SonarQube, Artifactory to name a few. In that work you will work closely with our development organizations and our delivery organization.

  

At Cambio, we encourage taking initiatives that contribute to the development of the company and ourselves. For us, it is important that you should have the opportunity to grow, both as a person and as an employee. Our culture is described through the words “Trust”, “Care” and “Together” which permeate everything we do.  

  

**About you**


To succeed in this role, we believe that you have great technical skills and have a keen interest in Infrastructure as code and software development. You enjoy putting together technical solutions with your team as well as developing and coaching the team further in your area of expertise.


You take pride in working together with other to solve problems and improve existing solutions. You are detail-oriented, organized, and able to manage multiple tasks and priorities simultaneously. You are proactive and able to take the initiative to identify areas for improvement. You have excellent communication and interpersonal skills to effectively collaborate with other teams and stakeholders. You have a strong willingness to learn and stay up to date with the latest technologies and tools in the DevOps space.

**Requirements**

* Experience of working with infrastructure development or related areas.
* Expertise in developing tools using scripting languages such as PowerShell, Bash, and Python.
* MS SQL Server
* Experience on infrastructure automation using Ansible or similar frameworks.
* Can communicate fluently in Swedish and in English.

**It's a bonus if you**

* Experience with Terraform or similar IAC frameworks
* Experience of tools such as: Artifactory, Gitlab or similar.
* Experience in CI/CD development.
* Experience with Greylog or similar log frameworks
* Experience with Java development

**Place of employment**: Linköping


At Cambio we value a healthy work-life balance, and to encourage that we apply a hybrid working-model. Together with your team you decide which days you work at the office. On the remaining days you can work remotely from home, but you are always more than welcome to work at the office too.

**Scope**: Full time

**Form of employment:** Permanent employment, 6 months trial period

**Other:** The job requires being on-call at certain times.


We screen the applications and hold interviews continuously so please send your application as soon as possible via the link.


We encourage and eagerly welcome all applications, but we will only consider candidates who are located and have the legal right to work in **Sweden.** We will ask for verification during the process.

**We look forward to receiving your application!**


Read more about us **here!**


Are you interested in Cambio but you don’t feel that this position is the perfect match? Check out our other open positions at the career site **here!**

title: New assignment - Mid-Senior SRE/devops
description:
**Start****ASAP****Duration****7-9 months**
  
Do you love being in the flow as a developer and want to enable that for everyone else as well? Do you believe that the key to personal flow is in making the local developer build experience fast, well-integrated, automated and with meaningful insights? We are seeking a collaborative and curious Engineer to help drive and develop our CI infrastructure forward.

  

Continuous Integration (CI) is at the core of our developer experience. The clients growth and widespread prescense has led them to require an ever wider and deeper range of target platforms to run CI against. In a context where early adoption and swift flexibility is at utmost importance we need to provide CI environments that enables us to deliver functionality to our customers with both speed and safety. This role will be part of a team collaboratively creating and owning our CI infrastructure for our client which aims to provide our developers with a streamlined, simple to use and safe build experience at scale.The role is located in the Platform Developer Experience (PDX) studio within the Platform Mission. The PDX Studio oversees and owns the infrastructure that cuts across all engineering disciplines at our client.


What you will do:

* Execute on our clients future CI infrastructure strategy that is able to serve 3000+ engineers doing 100’s of thousands of builds daily and beyond
* Support with Operational tasks keeping our systems healthy and uptodate
* Drive the automation and improvements of our CI system across our current technical stacks.
* Help scale our CI infrastructure to support large-scale monorepos.
* Collaborate with Infrastructure teams across the company to discover what a best in class CI infrastructure means.

**Who you are**

* You are an experienced engineering familiar with Linux, MacOS, and Windows as well as Networking fundamentals
* You are an experienced Software Engineer with Java and Python
* You have experience deploying to and implementing solutions in GCP, Azure, and/or AWS.
* You believe in iteration and know that finding the right solution is more important than the first.
* You like to focus on standardization and automation; always looking for ways to improve the developer experience
* You have 6+ years of experience in building and implementing large-scale systems across various projects and teams
* You have familiarity with and enthusiasm for software engineering best practices such as testing, continuous integration, and continuous delivery

**Skills**

* Linux, MacOS, and Windows system administration experience
* HTTP / networking
* Google Cloud (preferred) / Azure / AWS
* Teamcity Integrations
* Ansible
* Java (Spotify’s standard programming tech stack)
* Python
* Docker
* Communication
* Written and verbal communication


Start Date: 2024-10-14  

End Date: 2025-04-30


  
Takin Kouchmeshki
Executive Area Manager


takin@emagine-consulting.se
+46 725797969
