title: IT-Arkitekt till Reitan Convenience Sweden
description:
Som IT-Arkitekt hos Reitan Convenience Sweden (RCS) har du en nyckelroll i att leda arbetet med IT-arkitektur hos de två största varumärkena i koncernen, vilka är Pressbyrån och 7-Eleven. RCS är franchisegivare för cirka 400 butiker som drivs av framgångsrika köpmän där din roll är att vidareutveckla IT-arkitekturen och se till så att den stödjer verksamhetens tekniska behov nu och i framtiden. Ta chansen och sök, urval görs löpande!
 



  

**Företag :**
 Reitan Convenience Sweden AB
 



  

**Plats :**
 Stockholm
 



  

**Jobbkategori :**
 Teknik
 



  

**Omfattning :**
 Heltid, Heltid
 



  

**Startdatum :**
 Enligt överenskommelse
 



  

**Typ av uppdrag :**
 Rekrytering
   




**Om tjänsten**

 På Reitan Convenience Sveriges servicekontor gör vi allt för att underlätta för franchisetagarna i deras arbete ute i våra butiker. Vi är starkt värderingsstyrda där omtänksamhet och att bry som om varandra är en självklarhet för oss. På vårt nybyggda servicekontor är vi ca 115 medarbetare uppdelade på avdelningarna: Sälj, Marknad & Inköp, HR & Hållbarhet, IT, Bygg & Etablering, Ekonomi, Affärsutveckling och Data Analys. Vi är stolta över vårt hållbarhetsarbete som du kan läsa mer om här .
 


  


  

**Du erbjuds**



  

  
* Att vara
   

**en viktig spelare i företagets förändringsresa**
 mot att använda teknologi för att förbättra affären, där du får stor frihet att förverkliga dina idéer och driva din agenda framåt, på det sätt du tror blir bäst.
  
* Goda
   

**möjligheter att påverka**
 i en bred och platt organisation.
  
* Goda förmåner och ett arbete där
   

**balans mellan arbete och privatliv**
 värdesätts. Exempelvis genom sommartid maj- september, friskvårdsbidrag, friskvårdstimme samt andra förmåner.
  

  


**Arbetsuppgifter**
  
* Äga ansvaret för den övergripande arkitekturen och de ändringar som behövs för att optimera arkitekturen utifrån verksamhetens behov
  
* Guida och styra interna utvecklingsteam i att arbeta i enlighet med övergripande arkitektur
  
* Agera rådgivare avseende arkitektur till övriga IT- och affärsfunktioner
  
* Samarbeta med övriga delar inom Reitan Retail
  
* Dela med dig av nya utvecklingsinitiativ, planera och estimera resurser, samt stötta projekt för att genomföra dessa initiativ
  
* Hantera teknisk roadmap för olika verksamhetsområden
  

  


**Vi söker dig som**
  
* Har flerårig arbetslivserfarenhet inom applikationsutveckling
  
* Har erfarenhet av att leda och stötta utvecklare
  
* Dokumenterad erfarenhet från att designa och implementera teknisk arkitektur utifrån verksamhetsbehov
  
* Har en eftergymnasial utbildning inom områden som systemutveckling, datorteknik eller motsvarande
  
* Har erfarenhet av att jobba med Google Cloud Platform eller annan liknande molnplattform
  
* Har bred förståelse av att jobba agilt, exempelvis enligt DevOps metodik
  
* Har erfarenhet från retailbolag och en förståelse för affärsområdet
  
* Talar och skriver flytande på svenska och engelska då du använder båda språken i ditt dagliga arbete
   

  

**För att lyckas i rollen har du följande personliga egenskaper:**
  
* Strukturerad
  
* Problemlösande
  
* Affärsinriktad
  


  


  

**Information om rekryteringsprocessen:**



  

  
* Telefonintervju med Academic Work
  
* Personlighets- och problemlösningstester
  
* Djupintervju med Academic Work
  
* Intervjuer + case med RCS
  
* Bakgrundskontroll och referenstagning
  


  

  

**Vår rekryteringsprocess**
  


 Denna rekryteringsprocess hanteras av Academic Work och vår kunds önskemål är att alla frågor rörande tjänsten skickas till Academic Work och ansvarig rekryterare Jessica Billquist, jessica.billquist@academicwork.se eller rekryteringskoordinator Minna Loosaar, minna.loosaar@academicwork.se.
 


  


 Vi tillämpar löpande urval och annonsen kan därmed komma att tas ned innan sista ansökningsdag om det är så att vi har gått vidare till urvals- och intervjufas. Rekryteringsprocessen innehåller två urvalstest: ett personlighetstest och ett test i kognitiv förmåga. Testerna är ett verktyg för att kunna hitta den kandidat med högst potential för tjänsten samt främja jämlikhet, mångfald och en rättvis rekryteringsprocess.
   




**Reitan Convenience Sweden AB**

 Läs mer om RCS här !
   




**Bli direktrekryterad till Reitan Convenience Sweden AB**

 Detta är en direktrekrytering, vilket betyder att den kandidat som får tjänsten blir direktanställd av kundföretaget. Rekryteringsprocessen hanteras av Academic Work.
   




**Har du frågor om tjänsten?**

 Mikaela Hofstedt eller någon av kollegorna i rekryteringsteamet svarar dig gärna på stv3@academicwork.se Ange annons-ID i ditt mail: 15100365

title: Senior Server Developer (C# .Net Core)
description:
Rovio is part of the SEGA family and world famous for our flagship IP Angry Birds - want to know more about Rovio as an employer? Click here.
   

  

 The Server development Craft is responsible for designing and implementing scalable architectures with .Net Core on AWS. The team believes in well-crafted software that increases the product value without compromising the productivity. Clean code, test driven development and SOLID principles are a reality applied to any project. The team is located in Stockholm and works in a hybrid model (2 days per week onsite).
   

  

 Currently not based there? No problem at all, we will help you with the relocation and work permit if needed!
   

  

 We are looking for a Senior Server Developer to join the team of 4 professionals. As a Senior Server Developer, you will primarily take care of developing features and maintaining the infrastructure of Angry Birds 2 game, but also participate in backend development of new game projects.
   

  

 You will have impact and fun at work by doing:
   

  

* Design, implement and test game backend functionality for games using C#, .Net Core, PostgreSQL, Redis
* Create, maintain and operate the game server cloud infrastructure. We use AWS with Terraform
* Ensure that game backends are efficient, secure and scale well
* Work with real-time gaming technologies for multiplayer games
* Integrate other cloud services to game servers
* Participate in designing backend solutions working closely with the client team
* Work as a team with other developers, designers and artists


 Experience and skills we are looking for:
   

  

* Solid server programming experience with C# and .NET Core where you have implemented solutions for games to handle millions of players
* Good knowledge and hands on experience of cloud platforms like AWS or Azure
* Experience in high-load services
* Good understanding of SQL and NoSQL databases
* Working experience with SOLID principles and TDD
* Understanding of game architectures and technologies


 It would be nice if you also have the following skills:
   

  

* Hands on experience with Kubernetes
* Commercial experience with AWS


 What’s in it for you:
   

  

* Opportunity to work on a large scale where your work impacts millions of people
* Chance to apply TDD and be an advocate of high quality code
* Keep up-to-date with emerging technologies and industry trends
* No crunch - we value work-life balance


 Interview process:
   

  

* First meeting: You will meet the TA Partner to get acquainted and learn more about Rovio and the specifics of the role
* Call with a Hiring manager: We will deep dive into your skills and background and also discuss what motivates you. This is also an opportunity for you to learn more about Rovio and the specifics of the role
* Assignment: We’d like to learn more about your hard skills through a relevant take home task, which takes a few hours
* Technical interview: We will invite you to present the assignment results to your colleagues in the Server development Craft for an in-depth conversation
* Final rounds: You will meet the Technical Director and Game lead. Our aim is to get a clear overview of your collaboration and communication skills, how you would fit with our working culture, your ambitions and where we can help you develop.


- 

 We welcome applicants to use the name they want to be addressed by in the application form, regardless of whether it is their legal name.
   

  

 At Rovio, we are also committed to providing reasonable accommodations for qualified individuals with disabilities or special needs in our working environment and job application procedures. We are committed to continuously improving workplace accessibility. If you have any questions before applying, please write to us at recruitment@rovio.com.
   

  

**What to expect when you join us**
**Meet the Rovians**
**About Rovio**
**Hiring process at Rovio**
**Diversity, Equity and Inclusion at Rovio**

title: Data Engineer
description:
**Palm is a company that welcomes applicants from all backgrounds!**
*Join us at Palm, a well-funded, early-stage fintech startup, on a mission to guide the world’s money flows. As part of our founding team of treasurers, finance specialists, and engineers, you'll help build a world-class treasury management system for enterprises.*
*Are you ready to build and own the data intra function from the ground up? Based in Amsterdam or Stockholm and open to mostly remote work? We want to hear from you!*
**About Palm Engineering**
 Engineering at Palm today consists of a team of five engineers with diverse engineering and cultural backgrounds. We are located in Amsterdam and Stockholm, mostly working remotely with frequent gatherings in one of our locations or at off-sites where it is warmer and sunnier 🏖️
   

  

 The engineering team has been working together since November 2023 so there is still a lot of opportunities for high impact work as well as playing an important role in further shaping the engineering organisation and culture.
   

  

 Palm Engineering is defined by our principles:
   

  

* Bias to Action: In the face of uncertainty, we prototype fast and often.
* Open Communication: We courageously voice concerns to realign our direction as needed.
* Passion for Challenges: We love the problem and embrace challenges.


 In order to achieve this we lean on a culture of collaboration and knowledge sharing, where curiosity, respect and openness are some of our guiding principles. We truly value diversity and are happy to have our perspectives challenged. And of course, let’s have fun together!
   

  

**Our tech stack**
* Data Pipelines: Python, BigQuery
* Database: PostgreSQL
* Cloud: GCP
* Version Control: Git
* We are continuously iterating and exploring technologies as we go - so there’s more to come!


**How will you make an impact?**
 After receiving a strong customer response of our data-intensive features, we now want to elevate them to the next level. In this role, you will be responsible for setting up the foundation for Palm's data infrastructure, collaborating with our ML engineer to deploy ML models and data pipelines to production, developing internal tools for various stakeholders to interact with data, and building infrastructure to monitor and improve performance. You’ll likely bring in new technologies to accomplish this.
   

  

 Your role will involve close collaboration with engineers, designers, and founders (who bring expertise from Fintech & Treasury) to determine how Data can best serve Palm’s customers.
   

  

**Our wish list**
 We are looking for a proactive and eternally curious person with a love for learning new things. The successful candidate will have experience maintaining production-level ML solutions and possess solid software engineering and ML principles. Strong Python and SQL skills are essential. You will likely have 5+ years of experience in software engineering, data science, or machine learning, including at least 2 years in data engineering or MLOps. We highly value the ability to collaborate effectively, a clear sense of ownership and clear communication. Experience with GCP would be a nice bonus, but it's not required.
   

  

**Benefits Of Working At Palm**
* Travel: Meet all your new colleagues at quarterly offsites - the last 3 were in Lisbon, Stockholm & Amsterdam.
* WeWork Membership: Work from home is our go-to - we love spending time with friends and family instead of commuting. We have WeWork memberships for when you want to escape into the city.
* Stock Options: Own a large chunk of Palm and reap the rewards as you help us grow the company to a global player.
* Pension & Health Insurance: Best-in-class local insurances and pension schemes so you don't have to worry.
* Wellness Stipend: 500 EUR in annual wellness benefits - gyms, massages, you name it.

title: Backend Engineer
description:
**Solve complex problems. Decode the future.**
 At Electrolux Group, as a leading global appliance company, we strive every day to shape living for the better for our consumers, our people and our planet. We share ideas and collaborate so that together, we can develop solutions that deliver enjoyable and sustainable living.
   

  

 Come join us as you are. We believe diverse perspectives make us stronger and more innovative. In our global community of people from 100+ countries, we listen to each other, actively contribute, and grow together.
   

  

 Join us in our exciting quest to build the future home.
   

  

**All about the role:**
 Our cloud-based, API-driven platform is the backbone for all our Software products which we deploy on worldwide markets. This is where we store data from appliances and users and build both generic and product-specific functionality. We develop our own user experiences as well as together with third-party developers. In this position, we are looking for a Backend Developer who understands how to create a great modular, scalable, and extendable architecture that serves both generic and application-specific needs. We operate DevOps-style on both Microsoft Azure and AWS (Amazon Web Services), and we combine PaaS (Product as a Service) services, open-source components and build our own modules depending on what solves the problem with the least complexity at the time.
   

  

 You will be part of a cross-functional product team based in Stockholm, working with Engineering, Design, and Product management to drive the digital design in the Consumer Experience organization. We work with our data-driven IoT-products and connected appliances in all categories and Business Areas.
   

  

**What you'll do:**
* Analyzing needs together with product managers, UX and other developers
* Participating in product design sessions with specific input on technical feasibility, scalability, extensibility, performance, and maintainability
* Designing and operating solutions using a suitable combination of Cloud-native PaaS services, open-source components, and implementation in mostly Java (Spring)
* Managing global-based services, considering localization and regional preferences
* Participating in team activities including OKR’s, sprint planning, scrum stand-ups, demos and retros
* Taking active part in team improvements in process, tools, technology and communication
* Contributing to product delivery through writing the clean code according to the set code style
* Designing and developing functional, unit, SIT (System Integration Testing) tests
* Taking part in PR review sessions


**Who you are:**
* You are a Quick learner and energetic problem solver, enthusiastic about creating and improving ways of working
* You are confident but without personal prestige as you thrive on cooperation, getting things done.


**Qualifications** 
**:**
* 3+ years of experience in developing systems, Java or Kotlin based (Spring) services
* Strong experience in RESTful-services
* Experiences with a following SQL/NoSQL, MongoDB, Redis, Kafka)
* Ability to write clean, well-documented, and maintainable code
* Familiarity with authentication and authorization mechanisms (e.g., OAuth2, JWT)
* Experience with DevOps tasks like setting up Databases, Redis and Kafka instances through Terraform, CLI or AWS console
* Ability to contribute with complexity, risk, and effort analysis in backlog creation and management
* Ideally you come with previous experience in on-line business, IoT products, API services, DevOps, and/or Consumer products


**Nice to have:**
* Experience working with Vanilla JavaScript or JavaScript frameworks or libraries such as React, Angular, Vue.js or Next.js
* Familiarity with containerization (Docker) and orchestration (Kubernetes)
* Proficiency in version control systems, preferably Git


**Where you'll be:**
 This is a full-time position, based at our Global Headquarter in Stockholm (Sweden).
   

  

 We are 60+ nationalities under the same roof and we enjoy the look and feel of the office!
   

  

 You will be part of a dynamic international team where English is the natural language.
   

  

**Benefit highlights include:**
* Flexible work hours/hybrid work environment.
* Discounts on our award-winning Electrolux products and services
* Family friendly benefits
* Insurance policy plan
* Extensive learning opportunities and flexible career path


 We look forward to receiving you application!
   

  

 As part of Electrolux, we will continuously invest in you and your development. There are no barriers to where your career could take you.
   

  

**Find out more:**
 Electrolux Group

title: IT-säkerhetsarkitekt inom Cybersäkerhet till Combitech
description:
**Som cybersäkerhetsspecialist hos Combitech bidrar du till att säkerställa säkerheten i våra kunders IT-miljöer och arbeta med intressanta och komplexa produkter, ofta i försvarsrelaterade system. Här får du möjligheten att arbeta i en kultur präglad av högt i tak, hjälpsamhet och en stark passion för säkerhet och integritet! Nu söker vi nya kollegor i Stockholm, Karlstad, Malmö, Göteborg, Trollhättan eller Växjö.**
 Din roll som IT-säkerhetsarkitekt inom Cyber Security
   

  

 I rollen får du stödja kundernas verksamhet inom IT- och informationssäkerhet. Du genomför behovsanalyser, kravställningar, jobbar med design och arkitektoniska säkerhetsfrågor samt granskar kravuppfyllnad mot standarder och Best Practise. Du levererar även gap-analyser och förbättringsplaner ingår i de dagliga arbetsuppgifterna. Områden där vi växer och har uppdrag omfattar bl.a. IAM, molntjänster, 5G, evalueringar enligt Common Criteria m.m. Våra kunder finns inom försvar, privat näringsliv samt myndigheter och verk.
   

  

 Vi är ett team på 14 personer med en bra blandning av seniora och juniora specialister på IT-säkerhet i produkter och system. Vi har en bred erfarenhet som vi gärna delar med oss av och mentorskap är en viktig del av vår utveckling.
   

  

 Placeringsort: Stockholm, Karlstad, Malmö, Göteborg, Trollhättan eller Växjö.
   

  

 Vem är du?
   

  

 Vi tror att du som söker har kunskap om, och intresse för, IT-säkerhetsarkitektur och granskning av IT-säkerhet i produkter och system. Rollen kräver mångårigt och gediget arbete i IT- och informationssäkerhetsbranschen och vi ser gärna lämplig påbyggnadsutbildning med t.ex. CISA, CISM, CISSP. Erfarenhet av ramverk som KSF, CMMC, CIS, etc. är meriterande.
   

  

 Meriterande är det om du också har erfarenhet av att leda och driva tekniska projekt. Har du tidigare erfarenhet av att jobba som konsult är även det en fördel.
   

  

 För att trivas i rollen som konsult hos oss ser vi att du har en god analytisk förmåga och viljan att hela tiden fortsätta utvecklas. Du jobbar systematiskt och metodiskt. Erfarenhet av, och vilja att, självständigt leda egen och andras verksamhet hos kund är väsentligt. Vi arbetar ofta i team med en blandning av seniora och juniora kollegor. Detta ställer krav på att vara samarbetsvillig, kommunikativ och ha god leveransförmåga.
   

  

**Då tjänsten kan innebära arbete som omfattas av försvarssekretess krävs det att du genomför och godkänns i en säkerhetsprövning med registerkontroll.**
**Låter det intressant? Hör av dig till oss eller skicka in din ansökan direkt! Urvalet sker löpande.**
 Kom & gör skillnad
   

  

 Vi tror att man gör ett bättre jobb om man kan fokusera på rätt saker, därför gör vi det lätt att kombinera jobbet med vardagen. Vi satsar på våra medarbetare, de utgör kärnan, hjärnan och hjärtat i vår verksamhet. Dessutom står vi på en stadig grund av högteknologi, forskning och anställningstrygghet med försvars- och säkerhetskoncernen Saab som ägare.
   

  

 För oss handlar det om hållbarhet - vi vill bli branschens mest hållbara företag; och för att vara ett hållbart företag i en hållbar framtid behöver vi investera i våra medarbetare. För oss är din återhämtning, dina utvecklingsmöjligheter och din trygghet lika viktigt som företagets framgång - utan våra medarbetare står vi stilla.
   

  

**Vill du veta mer om hur det är att arbeta hos oss? Kolla in våra karriärsidor!**
 Kontaktperson/rekryterande chef: Peter Döös, peter.doos@combitech.com, +46 734469265

title: Regional Marketing Manager
description:
**Regional marketing specialist**
 Canonical is looking for regional marketing specialists who will be responsible for developing long-term marketing strategy and executing campaigns for specific territories across APAC across a diverse range of products and industries to support our growth strategy. This is a hands-on, multi-disciplinary and dynamic position, requiring close collaboration with the regional Sales Teams, the Partner & Alliances Teams, Product Teams, and other Marketing functions.
   

  

 The ideal candidate is passionate about technology, technology marketing and the use of technology in marketing. They prefer to work in an environment that emphasises ownership of campaigns, collaboration, learning, curiosity and a drive to continually improve oneself / the team / the organisation. They love to problem solve, get hands-on, experiment, measure and use automation to make daily life easier.
   

  

 This role reports to the APAC regional marketing team manager.
   

  

**Location:** 
*This role will be based in our office in Taipei, Taiwan*
**What your day will look like**
* Develop and execute go-to-market strategy for certain industries within the APAC region
* Set relevant KPIs for lead generation, demand generation and brand awareness campaigns; monitor and improve them on a regular basis
* Build organic and paid campaigns from scratch including crafting strong messaging, and creating visual assets for emails, social media and paid ads in line with canonical's brand look & feel
* Own webinars and regional offline events at all stages from planning to execution including holistic pre- and post-event/webinar strategies, webinar set up, streaming
* Work with the CRM Team to attract, convert, engage and communicate with new and existing audiences
* Be fully responsible for the regional budget planning and execution constantly monitoring and adjusting it accordingly
* Collaborate extensively with regional Sales teams to get their insights and implement them to the regional marketing strategy


 We expect members of the Canonical marketing team to be excellent communicators who are at ease working with a complex mix of engineers, product managers, sales representatives and executives.
   

  

 Read more about the marketing team
   

  

**What we are looking for in you**
* Experience in B2B marketing for enterprise IT products, SaaS experience…
* Experience working with the APAC market
* Excellent academic results, with Bachelor's or equivalent in Business, Marketing, or STEM
* Excellent verbal, written, presentation skills in English
* Hands-on mindset and ability to test various marketing assumptions attributing to scaling the most efficient ways of achieving positive marketing results
* Growth mindset - enthusiasm for challenges and work ethic with a 'can do' attitude
* Objectivity and openness to others' views while continuously building a positive team spirit
* Proven ability to prioritise and meet deadlines without sacrificing quality


**What we offer you**
 Your base pay will depend on various factors including your geographical location, level of experience, knowledge and skills. In addition to the benefits above, certain roles are also eligible for additional benefits and rewards including annual bonuses and sales incentives based on revenue or utilisation. Our compensation philosophy is to ensure equity right across our global workforce.
   

  

 In addition to a competitive base pay, we provide all team members with additional benefits, which reflect our values and ideals. Please note that additional benefits may apply depending on the work location and, for more information on these, please ask your Talent Partner.
   

  

* Personal learning and development budget of 2,000USD per annum
* Annual compensation review
* Recognition rewards
* Annual holiday leave
* Parental Leave
* Employee Assistance Programme
* Opportunity to travel to new locations to meet colleagues at 'sprints'
* Priority Pass for travel and travel upgrades for long haul company events


**About Canonical**
 Canonical is a pioneering tech firm that is at the forefront of the global move to open source. As the company that publishes Ubuntu, one of the most important open source projects and the platform for AI, IoT and the cloud, we are changing the world on a daily basis. We recruit on a global basis and set a very high standard for people joining the company. We expect excellence - in order to succeed, we need to be the best at what we do.
   

  

 Canonical has been a remote-first company since its inception in 2004. Work at Canonical is a step into the future, and will challenge you to think differently, work smarter, learn new skills, and raise your game. Canonical provides a unique window into the world of 21st-century digital business.
   

  

**Canonical is an equal opportunity employer**
 We are proud to foster a workplace free from discrimination. Diversity of experience, perspectives, and background create a better work environment and better products. Whatever your identity, we will give your application fair consideration.

title: Senior Salesforce Developer
description:
Vi har nu ett behov hos en kund efter en Salesforce Developer och söker därför en kollega med nedan kvalifikationer. Tjänsten är en del av vår konsultverksamhet vilket innebär att du blir anställd som konsult och arbetar hos kund alt. interna åtaganden gentemot våra kunder.
   

  

**Vår ambitioner**
 Vår målsättning är att vara det ledande IT-konsultföretaget med de mest nöjda medarbetarna och kunderna. Hos oss arbetar du inte för cheferna – ledarskapet är här för att stötta dig. Vi sätter dig i centrum och strävar efter att du ska utvecklas och växa. Vi erbjuder en inspirerande arbetsmiljö med god stämning, intressanta projekt hos intressanta kunder och en stark kultur av kunskapsdelning. Vi har tilltro till våra medarbetares innovationskraft och ger dig och dina kollegor möjlighet att både utvidga och fördjupa era kunskaper.
   

  

**Jobbeskrivning**
 Du kommer att arbeta som utvecklare i ett av våra produktteam för att bygga produkter både för våra kunder och partners.
   

  

 Du kommer att ta fullt ansvar för att förfina och utveckla både små och stora funktioner i produkten. Du kommer att leda funktionerna tillsammans med produktchefen från början för att förstå problemet, kommunicera med intressenter och beroende team. Du kommer också att leda uppdelningen av funktionen i användarhistorier och leda diskussionen med teamet för att slutföra tillvägagångssättet och lösa problemet. Detta kommer även att omfatta arbete med icke-funktionella krav och att alltid inkludera dem när du utvecklar och implementerar lösningen.
   

  

 Du kommer att fokusera på kvalitet genom hela utvecklingsprocessen och följa arkitekturprinciper och riktlinjer. Du kommer kontinuerligt och proaktivt att hantera teknisk skuld på plattformen.
   

  

**Din profil (Skall krav)**
 Du har gedigen erfarenhet av att utveckla på Salesforce-plattformen och har varit del av agila produktutvecklingsteam. Du har en examen i datavetenskap eller ett relaterat tekniskt område, eller motsvarande praktisk erfarenhet.
   

  

 Samarbets- och kommunikationsförmåga är avgörande när du arbetar i en mångsidig och internationell miljö. Du har visat erfarenhet av att förstå affärsproblem och förmågan att självständigt utforma och utveckla Salesforce-teknikbaserade lösningar för att möta dessa behov.
   

  

 Du har bevisad kunskap om Salesforce kärnplattformens funktioner, inklusive Sales Cloud, Service Cloud och Experience Cloud. Du har erfarenhet av Flows, Apex, Trigger, Lightning Web Components (LWC), SOQL och integration. Du är också bekant med datamodellering, bästa praxis för databehandling, delnings- och säkerhetsmodeller samt integrationsmönster.
   

  

 Du har en djup förståelse för governor limits och Order of Execution. Du förstår och har erfarenhet av mjukvaruingenjörspraxis och dess tillämpning på Salesforce-plattformen, till exempel Test Driven Development och CI/CD.
   

  

 Certifieringar som Salesforce Certified Platform Developer (PD1/PD2), Salesforce Certified Administrator (ADM201/ADM211) eller Salesforce Certified Integration Architect är ett krav. Du är också engagerad i kontinuerligt lärande och håller dig uppdaterad med de senaste Salesforce-uppdateringarna, funktionerna och bästa praxis.
   

  

**Meriterande**
* Erfarenhet av att arbeta i ett team med fokus på front-end-kompetens.
* Erfarenhet från fordonsbranschen.


**Sista ansökningdatum:** 
 09-09-2024
   

  

**Vi erbjuder dig följande, Valet är ditt!**
 🚀 Spännande uppdrag hos våra många kunder. Vi fokuserar på långsiktiga uppdrag, vilket ger dig möjlighet att skapa värde för kunden samtidigt som du utvecklas själv.
   

  

 🌟 En trygg månadslön – tillsammans bestämmer vi en grundlön baserad på dina uppdrag.
   

  

 🚗 Tjänstebil – vi uppmuntrar dig att välja en elbil för en mer hållbar framtid.
   

  

 💼 Tjänstepension och stora möjligheter till löneväxling.
   

  

 🌴 Semester - Önskar du mer än 30 dagar semester?
   

  

 🏥 Privat sjukvårdsförsäkring, olycksfallsförsäkring och livförsäkring för ökad trygghet.
   

  

 📚 Kompetensutveckling – du får själv sätta din budget och välja vilka utbildningar du vill delta i.
   

  

 🕑 Livskvalitet - Har du kanske svårt att få ihop pusslet i vardagen och önskar arbeta lite mindre och ändå kunna tjäna lika mycket om inte mer?
   

  

**Om Deploja**
 Vi sysselsätter idag seniora IT-specialister, inom bl.a. utveckling, test, testledning, projektledning, databas, Drift, Linux och ser oss alltid om efter fler kompetenta medarbetare.
   

  

 Transparens och flexibilitet är i alla fall viktigt för oss, med oss får man som konsult majoriteten av sin egen intäkt, i snitt har våra medarbetare höjt sin ersättning med 43% och har samtidigt ett av marknadens bästa förmånspaket. De som är med på vår resa idag har en trygg anställning MEN sätter sin egen lön och bestämmer själva över sina förmåner så som pension, utbildning, arbetstid och tjänstebil.
   

  

 Våra kunder finns bland annat inom detaljhandel, bank/finans/försäkring, energi, transport och offentlig sektor. De flesta av våra kunder är i Stockholmsregionen men vi har även kunder i andra delar av landet.
   

  

* Vi hanterar ansökningar löpande, med hänsyn till höga arbetstrycket och semestertider dröjer återkoppling längre än vanligt.

title: Cyber Security Specialist
description:
**Cyber Security Specialist till DeLaval**
 Som Cyber Security Specialist kommer du ingå i DeLavals Information Security Team (DLIST) som tillhör IT-avdelningen. Gruppen ansvarar för informationssäkerhet och cybersäkerhet inom hela DeLaval Group och arbetar under styrning av Governance som arbetar tvärfunktionellt inom hela koncernen. I rollen agerar du som businesspartner gentemot verksamheten och är ett viktigt verksamhetsstöd. Då arbetet idag sker till stor del i en outsourad miljö innebär ditt arbete styrning och kravställning mot våra partners.
   

  

 I resan, tillsammans med IT-avdelningen, kommer en digitaliseringsutveckling att ske med fokus på att gå mot Cloud. Framåt vill vi bli mer flexibla och mobila med ambitionen att bli än mer globala, snabbfotade och digitala. Vi går också en spännande framtid till mötes när vi ska byta ut flertalet av våra säkerhetssystem och säkerhetspartners (SOC/MDR). DeLaval IT har som mål att gå mot en mer centraliserad, strukturerad och flexibel arbetsmiljö genom att ta tillbaka utvalda delar av den outsourcade kompetensen inhouse: processer, strukturer i arbetssätt, verktyg, system och spetskompetens står i fokus. Detta kommer i sin tur att ställa nya krav på hur vi behöver jobba för att möta föränderliga cyberhot mot verksamheten.
   

  

**Några av dina huvudsakliga ansvarsområden i rollen är att:**
* Arbeta proaktivt med att säkerställa att rätt säkerhetskrav definieras och implementeras baserat på identifierade risker
* Granska, analysera och förbättra befintliga säkerhetssystem och vara drivande i att integrera säkerhetsperspektivet i olika projekt
* Aktivt deltaga i val och införande av nya säkerhetssystem
* Ställa krav på och samarbeta med systemleverantörer för optimal systemkonfiguration utifrån ett säkerhetsperspektiv
* Jobba utifrån DeLaval’s policys och förbättra procedurer och standarder för säkerhet på koncernnivå
* Hantera och förebygga säkerhetsincidenter i nära samarbete med säkerhetsavdelningar inom Tetra Laval Group
* Genomföra, säkerhetsgranskningar och arbeta med Vulnerability Management, inklusive sårbarhetsscanningar och uppföljning av åtgärder
* Förbättra nätverkssäkerheten genom nätverkssegmentering och skapa High Level Security Design
* Delta i utvecklingen av DeLavals Cyber Security Awareness program
* Utarbeta Security Incident Response Playbooks
* Hela tiden jobba riskbaserat och med verksamhetens bästa i åtanke. DeLaval Information Security team (DLIST) ska agera som en möjliggörare


 Tjänsten är baserad på DeLavals huvudkontor i vår idylliska omgivning i Tumba, söder om Stockholm. Arbetet utförs delvis på distans men majoriteten av din arbetstid utförs på kontoret.
   

  

**Är det här du?**
 Vi söker en person med minst sex års erfarenhet inom Cyber Security. Du bör ha en relevant utbildning inom IT-säkerhet samt erfarenhet av Cloud Security och Endpoint Security. Certifieringar som CISSP eller GIAC är också viktiga. Vi värdesätter en god teknisk förståelse, erfarenhet av att arbeta med leverantörer och vana att ställa krav på säkerhet. Det är också viktigt att du har erfarenhet av sårbarhetsanalyser, sårbarhetsskanningar och hantering av säkerhetsincidenter i en komplex IT-miljö. Har du dessutom tidigare arbetat i en internationell miljö inom tillverkningsindustrin är det meriterande. Flytande engelska i tal och skrift är ett krav, medan kunskaper i svenska och andra språk är starkt meriterande, men inte nödvändiga.
   

  

 I denna rekrytering kommer dina personliga egenskaper att vara av stor betydelse. Vi letar efter en person som är självgående, drivande, kommunikativ, pedagogisk och som jobbar processtyrt. Du är van att arbeta med många bollar i luften men för den sakens skull aldrig tummar på noggrannheten. Du är en god förhandlare och en duktig kravställare. För att passa in i teamet är du en nyfiken lagspelare som inte räds för att kavla upp ärmarna och göra jobbet själv. Vidare har du en bra förmåga att kommunicera och arbeta tvärfunktionellt med många kontaktytor. Att utbyta kunskaper kollegor emellan kommer naturligt för dig. Dessutom har du en stark drivkraft och ett gott tålamod.
   

  

**Vill du veta mer?**
 I denna rekrytering samarbetar DeLaval med Level Recruitment. Vänligen sök tjänsten via Level Recruitments hemsida. Vid frågor vänligen kontakta ansvarig rekryteringskonsult Stina Koskijev på 08-120 50 421 eller maila på stina.koskijev@levelrecruitment.se (observera att inga ansökningar tas emot via DeLavals karriärsida).
   

  

 Urvalet av ansökningar sker löpande och tjänsten kommer att tillsättas så snart rätt kandidat hittats. Välkommen med din ansökan redan idag!

title: Contract Manager
description:
**Dive deeper. Decode the future.**
 At Electrolux, as a leading global appliance company, we strive every day to shape living for the better for our consumers, our people and our planet. We share ideas and perspectives so that together, we can develop solutions that deliver enjoyable and sustainable living.
   

  

 Come and join us as you are as we believe diverse perspectives make us stronger and more innovative. In our global community of people from 100+ countries, we listen to each other, actively contribute and grow together.
   

  

 Come join us in our exciting quest to build the future home!
   

  

**All about the role:**
 We are now looking for a
 **Contract Manager Software & Cloud** 
 in Krakow, Poland.
   

  

 You will be a part of the Global IT Sourcing team, a team reporting to both the Global Indirect Purchasing and Global IT organization. The Global IT Sourcing team consists of two main categories, IT Services and Software&Cloud, and this role will be part IT Services Category and you will report to the director of the IT Sourcing unit.
   

  

 The position includes building close relationship with stakeholders, mainly IT Delivery Managers, both in the business units and the global units, to understand the demand and support the delivery of Software & Cloud Services , such as SaaS, IaaS, Paas etc. The position includes building relationship with suppliers in order to understand their capabilities and fit towards our demand.
   

  

**What you´ll do:**
* Lead for Contract Management activities supporting Project Managers and Service Delivery Managers.
* Be accountable for of Contract Management Procedures & standards.
* Follow up of Supplier Service Performance KPI's (SLA´s) for dedicated Cloud providers.
* Support monthly Purchasing and Contract Management reporting.
* Ensure contracts changes and amendments are prepared and administered.
* Ensure contract compliance with all company policies, procedures, and standards.
* Manage key suppliers and contractual relationships on an operational level.
* Act as escalation point for commercial issues pertaining to vendor management.
* Have overview of existing and potential new business opportunities for selected suppliers / vendors within the Service delivery area.


**Qualifications:**
* Relationship builder with “can-do” attitude.
* Result driven, analytical and outgoing personality.
* Ability to work effectively independently or as a part of a multi-functional team.
* Good communication skills at all levels, both internally and externally.
* Organized, methodical with good time management skills.
* Knowledge and experience of of Software Licensee Contracts, Cloud Subscription and Service agreements and Service Levels Agreements, Service Descriptions
* Legal knowledge (advantage)


**Previous Experience:**
* Experience in contract management (3-5 years), within Software License agreement and Cloud Subscriptions Agreements, and/ or experience from Software Asset Management.
* Hands on experience of Software, Outsourcing, Services and Telecom agreements.
* Working knowledge of contractual aspects of Software and Cloud agreements.
* Proven track record of knowledge in software and license metrics and cloud agreements with quality and savings through effective negotiation.
* Proven ability to work across national and functional boundaries to achieve the best result.
* Experience at managing sourcing at a TCO level.


**Skills Required:**
* Microsoft Office 365
* SAP Ariba and ServiceNow


**Benefits Highlights**
* Flexible work hours/hybrid work environment
* Discounts on our award-winning Electrolux products and services
* Family friendly benefits
* Insurance policy plan
* Extensive learning opportunities and flexible career path


 As part of Electrolux, we will continuously invest in you and your development. There are no barriers to where your career could take you.

title: Account Executive, Large Enterprise
description:
**Why You Should Apply**
* You will deliver objective, actionable insights to CIOs and their teams within Large Enterprise accounts in Sweden.
* You will join a high-performing, global company that is seeing double-digit growth for 40+ consecutive quarters.
* You will work in a highly collaborative sales environment with excellent career growth opportunities – 95% of our leadership positions were hired internally.


**Position Summary**
 For our office in Solna, we’re looking for an Account Executive to partner with new and existing clients within Large Enterprise accounts.
   

  

 As an experienced sales professional, you will address your clients’ most critical priorities. You will identify opportunities for account retention and growth through contract expansion, introducing new services and products. This is a field-based role, selling directly to Large Enterprise clients; organisations with $1Bn+ in annual revenue, which includes 77% of the Global F500.
   

  

**Key Responsibilities**
* Quota of approximately $1M in contract value across 5-10 large enterprise accounts.
* Build trust-based, value-added relationships with C-level executives and their teams, primarily the CIO and CIO office.
* Drive account retention and growth by impacting their most critical priorities and demonstrate Gartner’s value.
* Drive new business with new logos, through networking, events and your own prospecting.
* Utilise industry knowledge of your specific market segment, stay up to date with trends to ensure an effective go to market approach.
* Collaborate across teams, regions and departments, sharing best practice, to ensure a best-in-class approach to strategic initiatives and growth plans.
* Support the business in improving diversity, developing fellow associates, and growing the team within an inclusive environment.


**Requirements**
* 5+ years of relevant sales experience, of which at least 2 years in a tech/IT environment. Direct sales experience within a software vendor, system integrator, IT consultancy & services, or a similar environment is highly relevant for this role.
* Experience selling to senior leaders, preferably the CIO.
* A track record of consistent (over)achievement on your goals and targets.
* Bachelor’s or Master’s degree is desirable.
* Fluency in Swedish and English.
* Experience using Challenger Sales or a similar sales method is a plus.


**What Gartner Gives You**
* Uncapped earnings and challenging and achievable quotas – 85% of our salesforce hit quota, unlocking accelerators every year
* An all-expenses paid "Winners Circle" trip for top performers; every year, 40-50% of sales associates qualify for this
* Best-in-class training, including an intensive 2-week sales expedition for new hires and continuous support after that
* Growth opportunities: our business is seeing double-digit growth, providing plenty of internal career development opportunities.
* Excellent corporate benefits.
* Collaborative, team-oriented culture that embraces diversity, equity, and inclusion, to empower each associate to be their authentic and best self.
* Virtual first policy, giving the chance to combine working from office and home.
* The opportunity to work with Global 500 and sell at C-level and work with some of the brightest minds in the industry and help them to build the successful organisations of tomorrow.


**Who are we?**
 At Gartner, Inc. (NYSE:IT), we guide the leaders who shape the world.
   

  

 Our mission relies on expert analysis and bold ideas to deliver actionable, objective insight, helping enterprise leaders and their teams succeed with their mission-critical priorities.
   

  

 Since our founding in 1979, we’ve grown to more than 20,000 associates globally who support ~15,000 client enterprises in ~90 countries and territories. We do important, interesting and substantive work that matters. That’s why we hire associates with the intellectual curiosity, energy and drive to want to make a difference. The bar is unapologetically high. So is the impact you can have here.
   

  

**What makes Gartner a great place to work?**
 Our sustained success creates limitless opportunities for you to grow professionally and flourish personally. We have a vast, virtually untapped market potential ahead of us, providing you with an exciting trajectory long into the future. How far you go is driven by your passion and performance.
   

  

 We hire remarkable people who collaborate and win as a team. Together, our singular, unifying goal is to deliver results for our clients.
   

  

 Our teams are inclusive and composed of individuals from different geographies, cultures, religions, ethnicities, races, genders, sexual orientations, abilities and generations.
   

  

 We invest in great leaders who bring out the best in you and the company, enabling us to multiply our impact and results. This is why, year after year, we are recognized worldwide as a great place to work.
   

  

**What do we offer?**
 Gartner offers world-class benefits, highly competitive compensation and disproportionate rewards for top performers.
   

  

 In our hybrid work environment, we provide the flexibility and support for you to thrive — working virtually when it's productive to do so and getting together with colleagues in a vibrant community that is purposeful, engaging and inspiring.
   

  

 Ready to grow your career with Gartner? Join us.
   

  

 The policy of Gartner is to provide equal employment opportunities to all applicants and employees without regard to race, color, creed, religion, sex, sexual orientation, gender identity, marital status, citizenship status, age, national origin, ancestry, disability, veteran status, or any other legally protected status and to affirmatively seek to advance the principles of equal employment opportunity.

title: Senior Account Executive - Customer Base
description:
****Your work days are brighter here.****
 At Workday, it all began with a conversation over breakfast. When our founders met at a sunny California diner, they came up with an idea to revolutionize the enterprise software market. And when we began to rise, one thing that really set us apart was our culture. A culture which was driven by our value of putting our people first. And ever since, the happiness, development, and contribution of every Workmate is central to who we are. Our Workmates believe a healthy employee-centric, collaborative culture is the essential mix of ingredients for success in business. That’s why we look after our people, communities and the planet while still being profitable. Feel encouraged to shine, however that manifests: you don’t need to hide who you are. You can feel the energy and the passion, it's what makes us unique. Inspired to make a brighter work day for all and transform with us to the next stage of our growth journey? Bring your brightest version of you and have a brighter work day here.
   

  

**About The Team**
 Workmates pride themselves on winning while having fun! That means supporting each other while driving accountability for amazing results and performance. This team is no different. Everything we do inspires a brighter work day for all. The Enterprise Sales team at Workday helps the company to continue to grow by balancing integrity and innovation, ensuring Workmates have the environment to bring their best self, and get better by pushing and developing themselves and the Workmates around them.
   

  

**About The Role**
 Here at Workday, our Account Executives are key players in our Field Sales organization. Our Customer Base sales team uses their extensive experience and consultative selling skills to initiate and support sales of Workday Solutions within Workday’s existing customers. This fantastic team of hardworking professionals play a key role in driving incremental add-on business into strategic named accounts. As a team, we believe that partnering with our customers to craft relevant solutions that deliver long lasting value is super important. We want to make sure that our customers are positively satisfied from day one and forever ongoing. In this role, you will:
   

  

* Be responsible for developing and maintaining relationships with existing customers with a focus on upselling via deal management
* Perform account planning for assigned accounts, coordinating with pre-sales and other resources to ensure strategic alignment
* Drive strategic add-on and renewal business of Workday solutions within Large Enterprise customers
* Coordinate cross functionally with Workday’s internal teams (pre-sales, digital, value & bid-management, marketing, technical and sales support)


**About You**
 Basic Qualifications
   

  

* ~8+ years of experience selling SaaS/Cloud based ERP / HCM / Financial / Planning / or Analytics solutions to C-levels from a field sales position.
* Experience negotiating deals with a variety of C-Suite Executives to close opportunities
* Experience with building relationships with existing customers for add-on or incremental business
* Experience in developing long-term account strategies with existing customers Other Qualifications
* Experience with managing longer deal cycles beyond 6 months, with large deal sizes
* Understanding of the the strategic competitive landscape of the industry by staying up to date with trends and customer needs so you can effectively position Workday solutions within accounts
* Experience leveraging and partnering with internal team members on account strategies
* Excellent verbal and written communication skills


**Our Approach to Flexible Work**
 With Flex Work, we’re combining the best of both worlds: in-person time and remote. Our approach enables our teams to deepen connections, maintain a strong community, and do their best work. We know that flexibility can take shape in many ways, so rather than a number of required days in-office each week, we simply
 **spend at least half (50%) of our time each quarter in the office or in the field** 
 with our customers, prospects, and partners (depending on role). This means you'll have the freedom to create a flexible schedule that caters to your business, team, and personal needs, while being intentional to make the most of time spent together. Those in our remote "home office" roles also have the opportunity to come together in our offices for important moments that matter.
   

  

**Are you being referred to one of our roles? If so, ask your connection at Workday about our Employee Referral process!**
 ,

title: Senior Client Director
description:
Kurppa Hosk is a brand agency with close to 80 employees across our offices in Stockholm and New York. We solve complex business problems by combining the sharpest strategic minds with the best designers in the industry, working across sectors to serve some of the world’s most renowned legacy brands alongside a selection of brave, progressive start-ups and scale-ups. We are also part of Eidra: a consultancy collective made up of the best companies within consulting, creativity, and engineering. We’re built to provide leaders with the concentrated expertise they need to drive commercial advantage at speed. With a foundation of management consultancy, we orchestrate the process from strategy to execution.
 



  





 As we continue to grow our offices in Stockholm and New York, we’re looking to bring on board a Client Director or Senior Account Director who can help us enable both new and current client relationships to flourish. A Senior Account Director / Client Director at Kurppa Hosk holds overall responsibility for a selection of clients and projects, actively leading and coordinating client assignments – typically for several clients and multiple workstreams simultaneously. They are responsible for owning the client relationship and for driving projects and processes forward – providing expert advice in all relevant areas along the way.
 



  





 Eloquently playing the dual advocacy role between client and Kurppa Hosk, this means working in partnership with both the client and agency team to understand business landscapes, project requirements, strategic objectives and ambition, before setting out a plan and scope to deliver success. You are detail-oriented but are also able to take a step back and see the bigger picture — identifying opportunities and challenges that lie ahead. You also have the requisite understanding to drive the commercial dimension of our partnerships together with the know-how to earn trust and advise clients through the process of creating meaningful and rewarding brand and business change. Intrinsic to this will be the ability to identify, initiate and orchestrate complex, transformative assignments across multiple Eidra companies leveraging the full value proposition of the group.
 



  





 As a person, you are driven
 **,** 
 and welcome equal parts responsibility and accountability. Diverse in your skillset, you have experience of managing both strategic and creative development processes and projects. You are innovative and like to push the boundaries and as such, are able to adapt your experiences and take on new challenges if required — even if this means stepping out of your comfort zone from time to time, you maintain an attitude of ‘anything is possible’. You have a proven track record of or evident talent for and interest in developing long term brand partnerships alongside managing complex project lifecycles from beginning to end, getting the best out of cross-disciplinary teams to create brand experiences that can travel across platforms and create lasting impact for businesses.
 



  





**What we offer:** 



* The opportunity to drive transformation for some of the world’s leading brands, in a highly international context
* A highly stimulating and collaborative work environment comprised of highly talented consultants, creatives and engineers across the Eidra group
* Newly refurbished, state-of-the-art offices at Grev Tureplan, Stockholm
* A thriving agency culture and extracurricular scene
* Competitive salary and comprehensive benefits



  





**Main responsibilities:** 



* Overall responsibility for a selection of KH’s clients and assignments
* Actively lead and coordinate client assignments, advising and supporting the client in all relevant areas throughout the process.
* Autonomous management of transformational workstreams involving cross-disciplinary Eidra teams
* Develop existing client relationships and proactively initiate new projects.
* Manage interdisciplinary teams to execute strategic and conceptual work plus the subsequent implementation of defined deliverables; establishing the most viable approach and ensuring that every team member understands their role, tasks and deadlines
* Prepare, lead and follow up on client meetings, keeping stakeholders informed, internally as well as externally.
* Project planning and definition of project scope and approach, including objectives, deliverables, schedule and budget.
* Plan and organize pitch processes and participate in other new business activities.



  





**The ideal person:** 



* Has a genuine understanding and interest in solving business problems with creativity as well as a passion for the art and craft of branding.
* Has a proven track record of having successfully managed or an evident talent for managing complex accounts and large-scale brand, communication and digital development projects.
* Is eager to grow further and become a trusted brand advisor to our clients.
* Has the grit and stamina to keep pushing for quality in long-term brand partnerships
* Has excellent communication skills in both Swedish and English, both verbally and written (the KH office is English-first)
* Has exceptional relationship-building, negotiation and presentation skills
* Is a flexible and pragmatic person who remains calm in a fast-paced environment
* Has a positive, collaborative and creative, problem-solving attitude
* Documented international experience is highly desirable.
* Minimum education level BA or equivalent education in relevant field

title: Solution Architect - Global ISVs and Embedded Partners
description:
**Build your future with Sovos.**
 If you're seeking a career where innovation meets impact, you've come to the right place. As a global leader, Sovos is transforming tax compliance from a business requirement to a force for growth while revolutionizing how businesses navigate the ever-changing regulatory landscape.
   

  

 At Sovos, we're dedicated to more than just solving compliance challenges – we're committed to making a positive and lasting difference in everything we do. Our teams operate on the modern edge of digital technology, working not only to solve complex business challenges but also to enrich our personal, professional, and local communities.
   

  

 Our purpose-built systems provide the tools you need to thrive in a world where governments demand increased visibility, faster reporting and greater control over business processes. Excited about the possibilities? So are we!
   

  

 Don’t worry if you don't check all the boxes – apply anyway! We're focused on hiring the right people, not just the "right" resume. It's not about what you've done elsewhere; it's all about what you're capable of doing here.
   

  

**The Work You'll Do**
 The Solution Architect - ISVs and Embedded Partners will play a pivotal role in supporting and expanding Sovos’ global ISV ecosystem and revenue stream. This role involves engaging with both current and prospective strategic ISVs throughout the pre- and post-sale processes, ensuring they maximize the value of Sovos’ solutions through technical and compliance-related product envisioning.
   

  

 As the inaugural member of a new team of experts, the Solution Architect will lead in understanding and anticipating the technical and compliance needs of ISV partners. Fluency in APIs is essential, as this role will be crucial in assuring ISV partners of Sovos solutions' capabilities now and into the future. The Solution Architect will report directly to the VP of Marketplace & eCommerce.
   

  

**More Specifically, You Will**
* Collaborate with Partner Account Managers to align on new target ISVs and provide ongoing technical and growth support to existing ISV partners.
* Proactively engage target ISVs to foster collaboration towards joint embedded/white label offerings that provide unique market value.
* Lead the solutioning component of the ISV client discovery process to maximize Sovos product penetration and address unforeseen technical, compliance, and GTM challenges. Deliver a strategic solution design document detailing technical integration and compliance requirements.
* Ensure continuous, bidirectional knowledge transfer with Sovos subject matter experts (SMEs) in Product and Compliance, providing key market feedback.
* Collaborate with Account Managers, Partner Account Managers, Sales Engineers (SEs), and the Compliance Team to include ISVs in the Account Planning process, ensuring the ISV solution is well understood and maximizing co-sell motions to drive new bookings and revenue growth.
* Build relationships with ISV Product and Compliance leaders to establish trust and respect, driving ongoing value creation for new and existing partner use-cases.
* Represent Sovos at marketing events, customer advisory boards, and user groups, showcasing thought leadership.
* Partner with key Product & Professional Services resources to ensure effective implementation experiences for ISV partners.
* Act as an escalation point for support queries requiring ISV-specific input to resolve customer issues.
* Exhibit integrity and ethical behavior in all interactions with stakeholders.
* Demonstrate initiative, drive, and determination to achieve results, success, and growth.
* Maintain high energy, enthusiasm, engagement, and commitment to action.


**What We Need From You**
* Bachelor’s degree in a related field, or an equivalent combination of experience and education.
* Minimum of 10 years’ experience in tax and/or ERP technology consulting or a similar role within the enterprise software industry.
* Proven understanding of the global tax compliance landscape, accounting basics, and indirect tax processes.
* Demonstrated experience with sophisticated enterprise integration scenarios, including IaaS, APIs, webhooks, etc.
* Previous experience supporting ISVs in pre-sales, professional services, or support capacities.
* Strong team orientation with a history of working collaboratively in a fast-paced environment.
* Ability to manage multiple projects simultaneously and prioritize activities effectively.
* Self-motivated with a strong drive to succeed.


**What Does Sovos Offer You?**
 The tools to enhance your life - because we want you to enjoy your life outside of work and inside!
   

  

* Flexible Time-Off
* Competitive salary and uncapped commissons
* Comprehensive health, dental and vision benefits
* 401(k) match
* Tuition Reimbursement
* Bi-Weekly Meeting Free Days!
* Mentoring Programs
* Globally recognized Training and Development programs


 Sovos is an equal opportunity employer committed to providing an environment that celebrates diversity and where equal employment opportunities are available to all applicants and employees. We do not discriminate against race, color, religions, national origin, age, sex, marital status, physical or mental disability, veteran status, gender identity, sexual orientation, or any other characteristic provided by law. At Sovos, all employees are encouraged to bring their whole selves to work.
   

  

**Company Background**
 Sovos is a global provider of tax, compliance and trust solutions and services that enable businesses to navigate an increasingly regulated world with true confidence. Purpose-built for always-on compliance capabilities, our scalable IT-driven solutions meet the demands of an evolving and complex global regulatory landscape. Sovos’ cloud-based software platform provides an unparalleled level of integration with business applications and government compliance processes.
   

  

 More than 100,000 customers in 100+ countries – including half the Fortune 500 – trust Sovos for their compliance needs. Sovos annually processes more than three billion transactions across 19,000 global tax jurisdictions. Bolstered by a robust partner program more than 400 strong, Sovos brings to bear an unrivaled global network for companies across industries and geographies. Founded in 1979, Sovos has operations across the Americas and Europe, and is owned by Hg and TA Associates. For more information visit http://www.sovos.com and follow us on LinkedIn and Twitter .

title: Senior Data Analyst
description:
**Company Description** 




 Merkle Sweden - a Dentsu company is a consultancy firm with expertise in the areas of digital analytics and conversion optimization. We help large corporations and organizations collect, interpret, and act on data from their digital touchpoints, such as apps and websites, and use the data to make their communications and marketing efforts more hard-hitting.
 



 Our extensive experience and deep proficiency in Google Analytics 360 and Google Optimize mean that our clients rely on us for their most complex, challenging assignments.
 



  





**Job Description:** 




 Merkle is looking for a driven specialist with a huge interest in data and analytics. You’ll be based in either Gothenburg or Stockholm.
 


* Implement metrics for clients and provide regular analysis.
* Give recommendations for measurement solutions for digital services based on clients’ business and activity goals.
* Maintain and develop a strong know-how of Google Marketing Platform in general and Google Analytics 360 in particular. Other measurement tools may be used.
* Provide insights and recommendations that improve clients’ activities and business.
* Develop data-visualization solutions (in dashboards) that make it possible for clients to follow sales and other important performance indicators in real time.



  





**Qualifications:** 



* Minimum of 3 years’ experience in similar role
* Experience working with large amounts of data and an understanding of SQL and databases.
* In-depth knowledge of working with Google Analytics data, being an advanced user.
* Presentation skills to both large and small groups of varying degrees of knowledge, internally within the Group and also with clients.
* Ability to manage different work tasks and projects and prioritize accordingly as you will be working with several clients and projects at the same time.
* Ability to work with data analysis and provide accurate recommendations based on data.
* Knowledge of data-visualization tools, formal statistics training, and experience with Google Cloud (especially BigQuery) are desirable.
* Good communication skills in Swedish and English, both in speaking and writing.



  





**Some of the Perks We Offer:** 



* We have a collective agreement and attractive benefits. Several years in a row, we have won the DI Gasell Award, won the Mästargasellen Award, and been named a “Superföretag” (Super Company) by Veckans Affärer and Bisnode.
* Friendly, knowledgeable colleagues who like to share their knowledge.
* Possibility to work with multinational companies in a number of different industries, meaning you get a wide range of experience and the chance to work with different data sets.
* Working for a certified reseller of several Google Marketing Platform products and working closely with Google in Sweden, England, Ireland, and the United States. We are the biggest player in the Nordics when it comes to Google Analytics 360.
* Continuous personal development in the form of lab days, groups exchanging experiences, and your own professional development budget.
* The chance to grow both within your area of specialty and within Dentsu, the global network Merkle Northern Europe is a part of.



  





**Inclusion and Diversity:** 




 Our diverse and inclusive culture enables our employees to bring their whole selves to work and be proud of doing so. For us, this is the foundation for great innovation which, in turn, generates better outcomes for our people, partners and communities. This is why we encourage applications from people with disabilities, and of all ages, nationalities, backgrounds and cultures.
 



 We are happy to discuss flexible and agile approaches to working for all our roles – we can’t promise we will be able to offer you everything you want or need but we do promise to discuss it with you openly and honestly. If you have any reasonable adjustment needs arising from a disability or medical condition to fully participate in the recruitment process, please discuss this with our recruitment teams.
 



  





**About dentsu:** 




 Dentsu Group is a global marketing communications company headquartered in Tokyo, Japan. It is one of the largest advertising and media firms in the world. The company offers a wide range of services in advertising, marketing, communication, and digital media, catering to clients across various industries.
 



 We help clients to win, keep, and grow their best customers and achieve meaningful progress for their businesses with the best-in-class services and solutions in media, CXM, and creative. For more information please see: www.dentsu.com.
 



  





**Working with us:** 




 Joining dentsu, you’ll join a team of 72,000 people. It’s an opportunity to produce career-defining work. Along the way, you’ll team up with inspiring colleagues and encounter a richness of clients, cultures, and experiences. We offer exciting challenges, a great working environment, memorable experiences, and opportunities to shape your future.
 



  





**Contact:** 




 We look forward to receiving your application for any questions, please contact the TA in charge of this role: Thomas Holley, Talent Acquisition Partner, EMEA, NE by email at: Thomas.holley@dentsu.com or by phone at: +45 53 84 75 82

title: Lead Front-end Developer to Live Arena Technologies!
description:
*Are you a senior front-end developer who is ready for the next step in your career and wants to take on a leadership role? Do you want to work with a technology that is about to revolutionize its industry? Then apply for the role of Lead Front-end Developer.*
**Your Workday**
 Live Arena Technologies has developed the innovative service AI Producer for some time, a cloud-based platform that revolutionizes the way video is produced in Microsoft Teams. With AI Producer, users can conduct everything from town hall meetings to professional webinars, with a quality equivalent to traditional TV production.
   

  

 The development team has grown significantly over the past six months, which has increased the need for a Lead Front-end Developer who can lead the team. In your role as Lead Front-end Developer, you will mainly focus on new development of the product. Work is underway to redesign the interface with a new layout and design, which will be implemented in the fall.
   

  

 Moreover, you will take on a team leader role, guiding and supporting the team and its delivery. You will be the main point of contact for the team with other parties internally and help the team members in their daily work. You will also have the chance to work on improving working methods and structure in your group to enhance the quality of your output.
   

  

**Who are you?**
 To fit the role of Lead Front-end Developer, we believe you have:
   

  

* Several years of experience working as a front-end developer, preferably in a leading role.
* Experience with frameworks such as React, Angular and/or Aurelia
* Experience with API, REST Integrations
* Experience with SOLID Principles
* Speaks and writes English fluently


 As a person, you have a strong passion for your work and a desire to develop in your role. You act with a lack of prestige and do not back down to help where needed. Furthermore, you are a person who is flexible and can adapt when your context changes.
   

  

**Are we a good fit?**
**LIVEARENA TECHNOLOGIES**
 Our
 **vision is to democratize video production.**
 Until now, professional broadcasts or presentations have only been available to a few. The studio costs and the expertise needed to perform a professional broadcast or presentation have limited the access to most of us.
   

  

 We realized that this could be available to everyone, and the vision took shape and evolved into AI Producer – where everyone can become a broadcaster. All you need is a computer, Microsoft Teams – and AI Producer.
   

  

**OUR CORE BUSINESS**
 Our core business is to provide software for automated live broadcast productions. – by inventing solutions based on AI and cloud technologies.
   

  

 We serve all markets that want to harness the power of digital engagements, including: Corporate, Public Sector, Education, and Health Care.
   

  

 Our customers include small and large corporations and organizations worldwide.
   

  

**DEVELOPED FOR MICROSOFT TEAMS**
 LiveArena is a Microsoft Partner. AI Producer is developed to be used together with Microsoft Teams.
   

  

 Our headquarters is located in Stockholm, Sweden, and our North American office is located in Redmond, Wa, USA.

title: Mid-level Server Developer (C#, .Net)
description:
Rovio is part of the SEGA family and world famous for our flagship IP Angry Birds - want to know more about Rovio as an employer? Click here.
   

  

 We are now looking for a Mid level Server Developer to join our talented Stockholm Studio, home to Rovio’s iconic game Angry Birds 2. You will be designing and implementing scalable architectures with DotNet on AWS. The team believes in well-crafted software that increases the product value without compromising the productivity. Clean code, test driven development (TDD) and SOLID principles are a reality, applied to any project. Continuous improvement is a priority and the team is always eager to learn new technologies that help our growth.
   

  

 We are unfortunately not able to provide relocation support for this position.
   

  

 You will have impact and fun at work by doing:
   

  

* Design, implement and test game backend functionality for games using C#, .Net Core, PostgreSQL, Redis
* Create, maintain and operate the game server cloud infrastructure on AWS with Terraform and HelmCharts
* Ensure that game backends are efficient, secure and scale well
* Integrate other cloud services to game servers
* Participate in designing client/backend solutions
* Work as a team with other developers, designers and artists


 Experience and skills we are looking for:
   

  

* Solid server programming experience with C#
* Good knowledge and hands on experience of cloud platforms and related technologies like AWS/Azure and Kubernetes
* Experience in REST API based services
* Good understanding of SQL and NoSQL databases
* Understanding of game architectures and technologies
* Experienced either with playing or working with games


- 

 We welcome applicants to use the name they want to be addressed by in the application form, regardless of whether it is their legal name.
   

  

 At Rovio, we are also committed to providing reasonable accommodations for qualified individuals with disabilities or special needs in our working environment and job application procedures. We are committed to continuously improving workplace accessibility. If you have any questions before applying, please write to us at recruitment@rovio.com.
   

  

**What to expect when you join us**
**Meet the Rovians**
**About Rovio**
**Hiring process at Rovio**

title: Software Test Engineer
description:
**Summary**


With its comprehensive ITS (Intelligent Transportation Systems) portfolio, Our customer is actively addressing the challenges of the present and the future with intelligent mobility solutions in a wide range of application areas.


**Key Responsibilities:**

* Work in our development teams and test Computer Vision applications for traffic solutions
* Prioritize, estimate, plan and coordinate test activities
* Design, develop, execute and maintain test automation scripts
* Design, develop, execute and maintain machine learning build and evaluation pipelines
* Identify, record, document and track issues
* Support System Integration Test scenarios
* On site: < 60%

  


**Requirements:**

* Degree in Software Design, Computer Science, System Engineering or similar
* +4yrs Experience in software testing: test automation and scripting (ideally in Python)
* You have practice with software tools and workflows (e.g. Jira, Confluence, Git, Gitlab)
* You are familiar with Linux (Bash)
* Passion to drive collaboration and deliver high quality across an international team
* Eager to learn innovative technologies, research and apply learnings to daily work
